loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Rose is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Rose has been raising pigs for 19 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula appreciates the previous loans that have helped her to support her family through the profit she has earned.  Here again she comes to you, asking for a loan of 15,000 KES in order to buy four goats to sell.  She will also use a portion of the loan to pay for transportation to her place of operation.

She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy four goats to sell and to pay for transportation to her place of operation.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman and she has been blessed with seven children who attend school.  She lives at her own house, which has no electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a fish selling business, which has been in business for over five years. She mentioned that seasonality is a challenge she faces in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the loan of 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale.  She joined Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Lino

texts.en: Lino is a 33 year old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas ,yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Lino has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killer, water gallon, tarpaulin, and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Lino hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, water gallon, tarpaulin, and a crowbar

loans.name: Maimau

texts.en: Maimau is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling cooked food in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Maimau has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, chop suey noodles, curry powder, dripping oil and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maimau will help her family with their everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, chop suey noodles, curry powder, dripping oil and foam plates for her food sales business

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
La señora María Juana es una persona muy  emprendedora, responsable, honesta y trabajadora,   vive  con sus hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio  es la  venta  de ropa  americana. 
Doña María Juana el préstamo lo necesita para compra de camisas,  fajas,  gorras, pantalones, blusas, vestidos, etc.  
Doña María Juana en el futuro espera que  su negocio siga  creciendo  al contar  con mas capital para la inversión y que  se siga posesionándose  como el mejor  negocio  de  esa  zona. Gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo. 
Doña María Juana sueña con ver a sus  hijos  realizados  y convertidos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre   del  2013
texts.en:
María Juana is a very enterprising, responsible, honest, and hardworking person.  She lives with her children in southern Honduras.  Her business is selling American clothing.  

María Juana needs this loan to buy shirts, belts, hats, pants, blouses, dresses, etc. 

In the future, María Juana hopes that her business will keep growing as she is able to have more capital to invest and that it keeps its establishing itself as the best business in the area thanks to her investment in it.  

María Juana dreams of seeing her children develop and become upstanding people with better opportunities for society.  


Choluteca, Honduras –  October  2013

loans.use: to buy shirts, belts, hats, pants, blouses, dresses, etc., for her business

loans.name: María Salvadora

texts.es:
La señora María Salvadora habita en la comarca La Palma, un caserío ubicado a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce donde sus pobladores se caracterizan por dedicarse a la actividad ganadera y agrícola.
Doña Salvadora además de dedicarse a esta actividad con su esposo también se dedica al comercio como la venta de ropa nueva tanto para damas como para caballeros, esta actividad la inició hace 34 años con capital que le obsequió su esposo para que ella generara sus propios ingresos fue así que con la ganancia de éste ayudo a preparar a su hijo como abogado el que ahora es independiente.
Esta señora es admirable porque a pesar de su edad se esfuerza día a día para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para hacer los quehaceres del hogar y sale desde muy temprano para el municipio de Achuapa o El Sauce recorriendo las calles para ofrecer el producto.
Debido a la temporada navideña donde hay promociones, bodas, quince años, son celebraciones que acostumbran a realizarlas en Diciembre, las personas demanda la ropa nueva por lo que doña Salvadora en este momento tiene muchos encargos y no dispone de mucho capital por lo que está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con fondos Kiva con el cual comprará ropa interior, pantalón de mujer, capri, licras, camisas de varón, pantalón de varón, faldas, blusas.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
María Salvadora lives in the La Palma region, in a hamlet 10 km from the town of El Sauce, where the local population mostly works in livestock farming and agriculture. 

As well as farming with her husband, María Salvadora also works as a vendor, selling new clothing for both women and men. She began this business 34 years ago with capital given to her by her husband, in order to generate her own income. It was with these earnings that she helped her son to train as a lawyer, and he is now independent.

She is a remarkable woman, as despite her age she works hard day after day to take home the daily bread. She gets up at four o'clock in the morning to carry out her household chores, and she leaves very early to go to the town of Achuapa or El Sauce, where she traverses the streets offering her products for sale.

With the Christmas season coming up, including many celebrations that are often held in December such as promotions, weddings and quince años [fifteenth birthday parties], people want new clothes. At the moment María Salvadora has many orders, but she does not have much capital available. For this reason she is seeking a credit from CEPRODEL, with funds from Kiva, which she will use to buy underwear, women's pants, skirts and blouses, and men's shirts and pants.

She hopes and trusts in God that people with good hearts will support her loan, and she will be able to make her investment.

loans.use: to buy underwear, women's pants, skirts and blouses, and men's shirts and pants.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a very hardworking man from Nyahururu. He is 35 years old, not yet married, and supports his parents and siblings.

He is a kerosene vendor, which is a business he has been running for the last four years. John has applied for his first loan of KES 80,000 from Kadet Ltd., which he intends to use for buying stocks of kerosene in drums and others in Jerrycans, to serve more customers, thus increase his income.

His monthly income right now is KES 10,000, and his plan is to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd. and expand his business.

He hopes to own a petrol station in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of kerosene in drums and others in Jerrycans.

loans.name: Priscilla Jane

texts.en:
Priscilla Jane is 39 years old.  She is married and has one child who attends school. Priscilla Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Priscilla Jane runs a business, buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  She has been in business for 10 years.  Priscilla Jane has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Priscilla Jane would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Alicia has been in this business for 13 years. She earns more income from fishing.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mily

texts.en:
Mily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Mily is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment, and she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo operates a clothes-selling business. She sells to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), she wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Soad

texts.en:
Soad is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a Deir el Balah. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. He is also a student in a local university where he is studying for his Masters in Business Administration.

Soad is requesting a loan from FATEN, which she will use to help her husband buy a new laptop for his studies. With the computer, he will be able to write his homework and reports easily. Soad is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for her husband

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 23-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family is a very simple house in the city. Husam is a student in a local university. He studies finance and is in his last year. Husam's sister is an employee, and this is the only source of income to the family.

Husam took out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking out this loan, Husam will be able to work on his seminars and reports. This will help him to finish his studies, get a BA degree and then find a good job in the future.

Husam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 27 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, está casada con German y junto a él tiene 02 hijos, ambos trabajan mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, viven en una casa propia. El trabajo de Teodora, consiste en la venta de comida como arroz chaufa, pollo asado, carnes, salchipapas y otros. Su labor se inicia muy temprano con la compra de los ingredientes que usa en la preparación de los platillos. Tiene un pequeño restaurante en donde atiende a su clientela por las noches. Su establecimiento esta ubicado en una zona muy concurrida por lo que siempre sus ventas son favorables. Complementa sus platillos con la venta de refrescantes bebidas envasadas o refrescos elaborados con frutas regionales como camu-camu, cocona, aguaje o maíz morado. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad hace 05 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo o de su hermana. Cuando se inició en este negocio tenía escasa clientela ya que su rubro laboral estaba orientado principalmente a la venta de bebidas, pero poco a poco fue centrando su objetivo en la venta de comida y ahora le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes para elaborar sus platillos como arroz, condimentos, pollos, carnes, salchichas, verduras, frutas para refrescos, papas y otros.
texts.en: Teodora, who is 27 years old, is a kind and hardworking woman.  She is married to German and has two children with him.  They both work a lot to provide their children with a better quality of life.  They live in their own home.  Teodora's work consists of selling prepared food, such as fried rice, grilled chicken, meats, kabobs, and other dishes.  Her work starts very early with the purchase of the ingredients she uses to make her dishes.  She has a small restaurant where she serves her customers in the evening.  Her establishment is located in a high-traffic neighborhood, so her sales are always good.  In addition to her prepared meals, she sells refreshing bottled drinks or drinks made from local fruits, such as camucamu, cocona, aguaje, or purple corn.  She has had this business for five years.  Sometimes her husband or her sister help her.  When she started this business she had few customers and now it is going very well for her.  She is currently asking for 1,000 soles and she is thankful for the opportunity she has been offered to make her work plans a reality.  With the requested amount she will buy ingredients to make her dishes, such as rice, condiments, chicken, meat, sausages, vegetables, fruits to make drinks, potatoes, and others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as rice, condiments, and chicken, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his home

loans.name: Yesika Ondina

texts.es:
La joven Yesika es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de gallinas y cerdos, desde hace ya  6  años.
Yesika sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su comunidad los cuales le  visitan a diario necesita el préstamo para la compra de más gallinas, cerdos y productos para seguir sustentándolos y así seguir realizando su negocio.
Yesica con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos y gracias a esto poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Yesica su sueño en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para  tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Yesika is a very hardworking, modest, and responsible young woman. She lives in a community in southern Honduras together with her family. She has been selling chickens and pigs for six years.

Her customers are neighbors and friends from the community who visit her daily. She needs this loan to buy more chickens, pigs, and products to continue feeding them so she can continue her business.

With this loan, Yesika hopes that her sales will increase and that it will greatly help her to meet customer demand since she does not have the products that her customers are currently requesting. And if so, she will be able to somewhat improve her and her family's quality of life at home with the increased income. Yesika's short-term dreams are to grow her business, and in turn, to be able to continue supporting her family and that her children have the necessary education to have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Hondruas – October 2013

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Suher

texts.en:
Suher is 35 years old, married and raising five children and lives in Ramallah with her big family. 

She started a small business sewing women's clothing in 2003; the business is very good, but more importantly Suher enjoys her sewing work that yields her a monthly income of $803. 

To further develop her business, Suher requested a loan from Ryada to purchase leather covers and thread in large quantities to sew women's clothes for the fall season. she will use the leather covers as separators for changing rooms. The earnings from this loan will be used to expand her business, and also to save money to buy two additional sewing machines.

Suher is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase thread and leather

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Emelia has been in this business for 22 years. Emelia earns more income from buy-and-sell nipa roofing.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a Kiva borrower.  She describes herself to be determined.  She operates a retail shop where she sells motor vehicle spare parts.  She describes her family’s challenge to be the lack of water dispenser.  She will use the loan of 100,000 KES to buy a water dispenser to store clean drinking water for her family.  In addition, she will add spare parts to her inventory to sell in her retail shop.  This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM and her previous loans were repaid successfully.

She hopes that in the future, she will economically sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food processing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from the direct selling of Avon and Natasha beauty and fashion products.  Lanie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase ingredients like peanuts, butter, sugar, etc. for her food processing business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her three previous loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like peanuts, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en: Agrifina is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She shares that most of her children have a decent job except for one son. Through farming, she was able to send all her children to school to successfully finish their degree. Agrifina also shares that she is receiving financial support from her children that is sufficient to sustain her basic needs, but she doesn’t want to rely only on their support. Agrifina engages in selling kitchen utensils like basins, cups, brooms, pots, and more. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy pails, dippers, kettles, casserole dishes, and frying pans. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy pails, dippers, kettles, casserole dishes, and frying pans

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva works hard to support four children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Melva requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Melva is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Mwanauru

texts.en:
Mwanauru is a divorced woman. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She sells cooked food from home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase food stuff, such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stuff, such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and sugar, for her business.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: Shumaila has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for the growth of her tailoring business, which she has been running for the past six months. She is 26 years old, a well-educated married woman with one son, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is enrolled in a local school and getting his education. She wants the financing so that she can provide quick services to her clients by opening a tailoring shop in the central bazaar. This will allow her to increase her monthly savings as well. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one and will greatly help in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to pay for expansion of tailoring business .

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer was born in 1972. He lives with his wife at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. 

Amer has been selling hot drinks for a year and a half. He started his project by moving around the neighborhoods and selling his products. Now he owns a kiosk where he can sell his drinks. 

He wants to expand his project by adding snacks, herbs, coffee, chairs and tables so that his customers can sit and enjoy their drinks. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy snacks, herbs coffee, tables and chairs for his business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in 1965. He is divorced and lives with his 5 children at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Mahmoud has been selling accessories and making perfumes since 2 years. He started his project with a small amount of money. Now he wants to buy a larger amount of accessories and materials to make more perfumes to earn better income, which will help him support his children financially. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy accessories and materials to make more perfumes to resell.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Suzan was born in 1980. She lives with her husband in a sector of Jordan called Irbid. Her husband is a dietitian. Suzan has been selling Russian golden accessories and home products for the past 3 years. She started this business with a small amount of products. Now she wants to expand her business by adding variety to her products, such as clothes and blankets. This will help to make a better profit and to earn a better income to support her and her husband, while improving their living conditions. She doesn't have enough money to increase her inventory and for this reason she applied for the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to add to her product line.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 42-year-old married woman living along with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to an ultra poor family. Her husband owns a small artificial jewelry workshop, which is the only source of income for his family. He manufactures varieties of artificial jewelry, including bangles, necklaces, earrings, and rings in the shop.
 
She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase metal for making artificial bangles and necklaces. Shehnaz hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy metal for making jewelry.

loans.name: Maroof

texts.en:
Maroof is a 59-year-old married woman and mother of ten children. For the past 15 years, she has been in the business of selling the vegetables she purchases from the market. She provides a valuable service in her community by selling vegetables to many of her neighbors, as well as different kinds. She also purchases goats and sheep, and sells them at the festival of Eid-ul-Azha. Her sons help her with her business, as does her husband, who is a school teacher. 

Maroof is in her 2nd loan cycle, and has a strong association with BRAC Pakistan. She has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats for next year to increase the income. She wishes to use part of the revenue for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala is 26 years old with two children. Her husband is 32 years old. Kamala has received an education up to class VIII (grade 8) and her husband is illiterate. Her husband is a mason & Kamala is engaged in making electrical board structures, which are used to house electric outlets and switches. Kamala wants to provide a bright future for her children as well as support her husband whose income is not enough for the whole family. For this reason, she has taken a loan from BJS to expand the business by buying more wood & preparing more electrical board structures. She hopes this money will give better support to run the family.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for preparing electrical boards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora María  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijas en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad. 
Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal y leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto, espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento  el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos. 
Doña María espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijas continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Maria is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives with her daughters in a community in southern Honduras. She runs a business making and selling tortillas and it is well known in her community.

Maria needs this loan to buy corn, lime, and firewood in order to continue making her tortillas. Thanks to this loan, she hopes to obtain the supplies needed to keep her business going and thus meet the demand of her customers. Similarly, she hopes to have a large increase in sales, which will mean a better quality of life for her family.

Maria hopes that her business will continue growing and become the best known in the community. That way, she can keep supporting her family and her daughters will be able to continue with their studies and have more opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has three children. She is now 51 years old and has a farming business to sustain her family. The couple plant and harvest rice to sell. They also pay additional laborers who help them in their farming business. 

Lydia hopes for plentiful harvest this next crop season, but she has insufficient capital, that is why she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 40,000 to invest in her farming business. She will buy fertilizers and pay labor cost for farming. 

She promises to pay back her loan in full, and she's hoping to keep her crop production productive in order to save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor cost for farming.

loans.name: Carmen Dario

texts.es:
El joven Darío  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con sus 2 hijos y esposa  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta  de gasolina.
Darío tiene más de 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  gasolina, con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Darío espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona, y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijos   ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos.


Choluteca,  Honduras  –  Octubre   del   2013
texts.en:
Darío is a responsible, hard-working and honest young man. He lives with his two children and wife in southern Honduras. His business is selling gasoline. Darío has had this business for over 2 years. The loan he needs is to buy gasoline. With the loan he hopes to increase his sales as he will have more product to offer and to serve his customers. Darío hopes to cover the needs he has and improve a little the quality of life for him and his family. In a few years he hopes that his business will continue growing and become one of the largest and well-known in the area, and continue supporting his parents and children as they have few economic resources.
Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy gasoline for his business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Lucy, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with two children, ages 7 years and 2 months old.

He is a vegetable farmer, which is a business he has been running for the last eight years. He would like to buy fertilizer and some pesticides to spray his vegetables for high and quality yields. To enable him to buy these chemicals, he has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is KES 12,000, and he intends to use the profits from his expanded business to start another business of buying and selling cereals and pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd.

He hopes for a successful future for his business and family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and some pesticides to spray his vegetables for high and quality yields.

loans.name: Lendie

texts.en:
Lendie is 30 years old.  She is married and has one child.

Lendie works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in business for five years.  She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items like milk, noodles and biscuits to stock and sell.  Lendie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF prior to this loan.  She also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Lendie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like milk, noodles and biscuits.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Connie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her electricity expenses.

Connie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp.

loans.name: Summaira

texts.en:
Summaira is taking a loan for her husband’s tailoring shop. Her husband is involved in a tailoring business in which he provides clothes stitching services to his customers. He is a great expert in his profession and people like to wear clothes stitched by him. Her husband has a lot of demand for ladies clothes and outfits, but he does not have an additional sewing machine to reduce the work burden.

Therefore, Summaira requested a loan from Kiva’s field Partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy a sewing machine. Summaira is 41 years of age and lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and seven children. She hopes that a new sewing machine will increase the family's  monthly income by sewing more cloths which lead to the establishment of business. She is very happy about this loan and very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is a 68-year-old pensioner woman. Her pension is 150 GEL per month. She lives alone in Rustavi district. Nanuli was trading clothes years before, but now the pension is her only income. According to the above mentioned situation, Nanuli lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of $1,200 and start trading business. She will purchase clothes from wholesalers and then resell at higher price. 

Nanuli thinks that the business will be profitable, as she is experienced in this field; she was trading clothes years ago. With the support of the Start Up program, Nanuli will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store business with her husband, who is also shown in the picture. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Asmat needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Asmat has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 31-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Bishnu, who is 45 years old. They have three children. Two of her children are studying in class VI (grade 6) and I (Grade 1), respectively, and one child is too small to go to school. He is only four years old. By profession, her husband is a mason. She wishes to cultivate broad beans (local vegetable) in her own land to generate more income. Having their own land and experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business. Gita is confident that she will be able to grow her business.

They don’t have a concrete house, so in the future, she wants to build a concrete house with the profit she earns from her business. She dreams that her children will lead a very successful life with a good education. She is a lady with great enthusiasm and never wants to stop fighting.

loans.use: To buy materials to cultivate vegetables

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a 21-year-old married woman with two children and her husband is 27 years old. Both of her children are very small and not yet in school. One child is three and a half years old and the other one is a newborn. 

Pratima is a housewife and her husband works as a day laborer. The earnings from his work are not enough for their growing family, so Pratima decided to shift to another business in the hope that they will earn more by growing broad beans and selling them in the market. They are expecting to have more income from this new business!

loans.use: To buy seeds for broad bean cultivation.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old and married with eight children. With two children still in school, Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, such as canned goods, soy sauce, candies, vinegar, and other groceries to sell.

Veronica has been in this business for 2 years, and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soy sauce, candies, vinegar, and other groceries. 

Veronica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, such as canned goods, soy sauce, candies, vinegar, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married with no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an air time selling business, selling at the shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a retail business in the near future. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase airtime for resale and pay rent for her premises. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase airtime for resale and pay rent for her premises.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. She has a grocery store and has been in this business for 2 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, bananas, vegetables and onions for selling. This will enable her to meet her customers' demands as well as make more income. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her 3rd loan term and she repaid all of her previous loans successfully. Mary's hopes for the future are to be successful in her business and be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 27 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Mae has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks, coffee, and milk to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, a 42 year old businesswoman from Matuu, Kenya, has a business as a poultry farmer. She is married to Theophilus who is a farmer. She also runs a general shop, a business which supplements her income. She earns a monthly income of 50,000 Kenyan shillings which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan term with KADET after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

With the loan she has applied for through KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks for rearing.  Additional income will allow her improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Stella would like to expand her hardware business further.  She hopes to someday have an established business and a settled family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Alberto Felix

texts.es:
Alberto, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la cálida ciudad de ICA. Alberto es una persona muy emprendedora, el actualmente tiene su propio negocio de Cerrajería en el distrito de Parcona, en el cual ya viene trabajando hace mas de 3 años, trabajo el cual le pone mucho empeño y responsabilidad.
Alberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá para la compra de materiales de su negocio y así brindarles un mejor producto a sus clientes.
El sueño  de Alberto es tener su propia casa, ser un gran empresario y seguir brindando el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alberto is 27 years old. He is single and lives in the hot city of Ica. Alberto is a very entrepreneurial person. He now has his own iron-working business in the Parcona district, and he has been working in it for more than 3 years. He puts much effort and responsibility into his work.

Alberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since he will invest the money in the purchase of materials for his business, and thus he will offer a better product to his customers.

Alberto's dream is to have his own house, to be a great businessman, and to continue offering the best service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be strong. She operates a retail shop where she sells shoes. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate water storage facilities. She will use the 60,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be rich. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a 1,800 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Thelma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Merciditha

texts.en:
Merciditha is 47 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merciditha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock including sugar, biscuits, rice, and canned goods, to sell.

Merciditha has been in this business for 8 years.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, biscuits, rice, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La joven María es una mujer dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de abarrotería desde hace 8 años, tiene su negocio  en su casa de habitación y es un punto muy bueno porque el tránsito de personas a diario es alto, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad.
María sus clientes le prefieren por la buena atención y su amabilidad, inicio su negocio vendiendo golosinas en su casa como tacos, enchiladas y pastelitos, etc. y con la ganancia de esto, logro montar una pequeña pulpería como hasta el día de hoy la ha logrado mantener y salir adelante.
María ocupa el préstamo para la compra de refrescos, azúcar, manteca, jabón, pollo, etc. y así poder ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos y la ves con las ventas espera obtener las ganancias necesarias para seguir mejorando su negocio y su estilo de vida y poder salir  adelante con su familia. 




Danlí, Honduras – Octubre del 2013
texts.en:
The young Maria is a woman who is dedicated to her business, which is selling groceries. She has had her busines for 8 years, and it is located in her home. It is a very good location because many people pass by there every day. Her principal customers are neighbors from her community.

Maria's customers prefer her because of her god service and friendliness. She began her business selling candies in her house, as well as tacos, enchiladas, pastries, etc., and with the earnings from this, she was able to set up a little grocery store, which up to this time she has managed to maintain and advance.

Maria will use the loan to purchase soft drinks, sugar, lard, soap, chicken, etc., and thus will be able to offer her customers a variety of products. At the same time, she hopes with her sales to obtain the earnings necessary to continue improving her business and her style of living and to be able to advance with her family.



Danlí, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, lard, soap, chicken, etc., for her business

loans.name: Hugo Armando

texts.es: Hugo de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida desde hace mucho tiempo. Hugo es un hombre muy trabajador quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Desde hace 7 años trabaja como jardinero en una empresa cercana a su localidad y de esa forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso ya que necesita un relleno para evitar que el agua se filtre cuando llueve. Con el crédito comprará piedra, cemento, arena y grava para levantar un muro y después rellenará el terreno compactando el piso así evitar que se siga inundando cuando llueve.
texts.en:
Hugo is 52 years old and lives in his own house together with his longtime life partner. He is a very hard-working man, who with a lot of effort has managed to provide for his family. For the last seven years he has worked as a gardener for a nearby company, which is how he supports his household. 

With the aim of improving the family's living conditions he is seeking this loan from FUSAI, to invest in fixing up the floor of their living area, which needs to be filled in so that water does not seep in when it rains. He will use the loan to buy stone, cement, sand and gravel, in order to build a wall and then fill in and compact the ground area so that it will no longer flood.

loans.use: to buy stone, cement, sand and gravel to fix the floor of his home.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her late forties, is married with six children.  Three of her children are in school and the remaining three are married but still attend evening college studies. For the past seven years, Mary has been running two businesses: tailoring and poultry (local chickens). Mary's poultry business was previously doing bad when more of her chickens died.  Now with the new advice she obtained, Mary's poultry business is improving. She works from 8:00am to 5:00pm each working day and is able to make a good profit.

This will be Mary's tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to improve her tailoring business by paying her landlord in advance to expand the premises. Mary also managed to buy two new tailoring machines and was able to pay her business rent without difficulties. Mary has successfully paid back all her previous loans. She used her profits to cover school fees and household expenses and reinvested back in her business. Mary will use this loan to buy more tailoring materials and pay rent for her place of business. Her dream is to open another branch at home so she can receive more orders. 

Mary will share this loan with her loan group, Kilombero, which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials and pay rent for her place of business.

loans.name: Justina Yuliana

texts.es:
Justina es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Justina no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Justina trabaja vendiendo juguetes en las calles de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Justina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de juguetes para la época navideña, de esta manera abastecerá su negocio para atender a mas clientes,así pues Justina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Justina, 25, lives in the city of Chincha with her young son. She is a hardworking single mother who dedicates all of her efforts to getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work, Justina wasn't able to complete a professional degree. Justina is self-employed selling toys in the streets of her city. She works every day for around 8 hours and she thinks that it's going well because of her dedication and effort.

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to buy a larger quantity of toys for the Christmas season. This way she can stock her business and attend to more clients. Justina will continue working hard to achieve her grand dream of owning her home.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Ada Pastora

texts.es:
Ada Pastora tiene 30 años de edad es agricultora y madre de tres hijos el mayor esta en secundaria, el segundo en la primaria y el ultimo aun no tiene edad escolar ya que solo tiene 2 años. Junto a su compañero de hogar trabajan arduamente para salir adelante por lo que temprano por la mañana se levantan diariamente para trabajar en el campo y poder despachar a sus hijos para que asistan a su centro de estudio. El café es el rubro que les proporciona a ellos la economía necesaria para poder ofrecer a sus hijos vestimenta, comida, alimento, medicinas aunque con muchas restricciones y lo necesario para cubrir sus estudios. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy niña gracias a sus padres pero también se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para poder vender ya que de esa forma también genera mas ingresos para el hogar y aprovecha la temporada. El terreno es propio gracias a una compra de las ganancias del café el cual esta ubicado a 500 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando en el cual se involucran para asistirlo ella, su pareja y su hijo mayor.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a mantener sanos y protegidos sus cultivos como también poder destinar otra parte para poder limpiarlo de maleza entre otros.
Sus metas son seguir incrementando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de mas tierra fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos; pero su sueño es poder seguir dando la oportunidad a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando y puedan graduarse convirtiéndose en profesionales y asegurando su futuro.
texts.en:
Ada Pastora, 30, is a farmer and mother of three children - the oldest is in high school, the middle in primary and the youngest is just 2 years old and not yet in school. Together with her life partner she works hard to get ahead, waking up early every morning to work in the field and send her kids off to school. They are in the coffee business, which helps them provide their children with clothing, food, medicines - although they are limited - and an education. She learned the coffee trade from a young age thanks to her parents, but she also makes and sells tamales in order to generate more income for their home and take advantage of the holiday season. They own their land, located 500 meters from their home, thanks to a purchase with the earnings from their coffee harvest. Ada, her partner and her oldest son cross the land on foot, tending to it.

Today she asks for a loan to buy fertilizers and other agricultural inputs that will help to keep her crop healthy and protected, as well as to clean weeds from the field. Her goals are to continue increasing her coffee crop by purchasing more land, which will strengthen her children's inheritance; but her dream is to be able to give her children a chance to keep studying and to graduate, becoming professionals and assuring their future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and clean her coffee fields.

loans.name: Anarjan

texts.ru: Анаржан 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Анаржан - высшее образование, работает в фонде развития экономики-главным специалистом. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Анаржан занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анаржан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 2 бычка, 15 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,50 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер, картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Анаржан входит в группу "Таш-Тобо", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое, Анаржан является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаржан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаржан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадьбы для старшего сына.
texts.en: Anarjan is 57 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Anarjan has a higher education and works as a chief specialist at the economic development fund. To provide additional income for her family, Anarjan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 18 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Anarjan's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 2 calves, 2 bulls, 15 sheep and also a 0.50 hectare land plot, where she grows clover, potatoes and corn. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). Anarjan is part of the "Tash-Tobo" group that includes two more persons.  All together, there are three of them, and Anarjan is the leader of the group. In order to further develop her business, Anarjan requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a heifer to increase livestock headcount. Anarjan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to hold a wedding for her oldest son.

loans.use: buy a heifer to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia works hard to support her family. Patricia is married and has a buy and sell spices and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of spices and vegetable to sell.

Patricia has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Patricia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Sarwar

texts.en:
Sarwar is living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and equally responsible for all of them.
 
She belongs to an ultra poor family, which is why she cannot cherish her children in a good manner. None of her kids has ever gone to school. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides welding services. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. He wants to increase his stock of welding material so that he can cope with the sudden increase in demand in the future. To fulfill the demands of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. 

Sarwar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he will be able to buy welding material to carry on his business.
 
She is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding material for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Венеры - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Венера занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,50 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль, картофель и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Венера входит в группу "Таш-Тобо", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Венера является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Venera is 39 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Venera has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide additional income for her family, Venera is involved in animal husbandry, having started 15 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Venera's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 3 horses, 10 sheep and also a 0.50 hectare land plot, where she grows beans, potatoes and clover. The monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). Venera is part of the "Tash-Tobo" group that includes two more persons. Venera is the second member of the group. In order to further develop her business, Venera requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy 1 cow and 10 sheep to increase livestock headcount. Venera plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy 1 cow and 10 sheep to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Sandra Vanessa

texts.es:
Sandra, de 46 años de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de su familia. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económico.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles crudos y cosidos, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, queso, cuajadas, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Sandra agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sandra, who is 46 years old, is a native of León, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. In her free time she likes to enjoy her family. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with the desire for personal advancement. Unfortunately, she was not able to study for a career due to lack of economic resources.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, she has a grocery store as her economic activity. It is a little store that sells food products in small quantities, such as rice, uncooked and cooked beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, cheese, milk curds, juices, and soft drinks. She works in her business some 12 hours a day. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling food products so that in the not too distant future she can obtain better income. Sandra is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store by buying products such as rice, beans (uncooked and cooked), sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, cheese, milk curds, juices, and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel mayor de edad casada con dos hijos mayores de edad del domicilio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación personal, María se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa interior, variedades estilo de ropa de niños y adultos, chinería, cosméticos, productos de limpiezas entre otros mas, también tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo diario, ella realiza sus compras al contado a comerciantes de otros municipios, ella ofrece sus productos en centros de trabajos y en los alrededores de su casa, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal al igual que ella cuenta con su salario que desempeña como conserje de medio tiempo, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería, y en compra de productos de consumo para el hogar y así suplir con las demandas que tiene en estos momentos por las fechas próximas. María Isabel agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrecen a personas de bajos recursos económicos.

loans.use: to invest in business capital and stock general merchandise to increase her inventory, as well as to buy basic goods for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Apiza

texts.ru: Апиза родилсь в 1961 года. Она вдова, так как в 2009 году умер ее муж. Апиза имеет удивительное ремесло. Она ткачиха ковров. Апиза сама обрабатывает шерсть, делает пряди, красит и ткет ковры. Апиза этим ремеслом занимается более 19 лет. Она имеет большой опыт. Апизе в этом деле помогают ее внуки. Ее сыновья находятся в Российской Федерации. Они там зарабатывают разнорабочим. Апиза кредитуется уже 36 цикл. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Апиза очень ответственная женщина. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки шерсти и краски. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Apiza was born in 1961.  She is a widow because her her husband died in 2009.  Apiza has a surprising trade.  She makes rugs.  Apiza treats wool by herself, makes yarn, paints and makes rugs.  Apiza has been involved in this trade for over 19 years.  She has a lot of experience.  Apiza's grandsons help her with this business.  Her sons are in the Russian Federation.  They earn money there working as handymen.  Apiza has been obtaining loans for 36 cycles.  She has a good credit history.  Apiza is a very responsible woman.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy wool and paint.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy wool and paint for making rugs

loans.name: Srin

texts.en:
Srin, 56 years of age, is a married woman who has been blessed with seven children living in Prey Kabbas district, Takeo province. She has been in the farming business for over 30 years. She works on 0.30 hectare of farmland and earns a decent income, which usually goes for meals. Her husband and some children also help her earn the household income in various occupations.

Currently, Srin’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this particular reason, she has requested a loan of 600 US dollars to build a household latrine. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is married with two children. She helps her husband in managing their rice farm to earn a living. They grow and harvest rice and sell a portion of the produce in the market for extra income. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and the previous loan she took was used for the farm and successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rezil

texts.en:
Rezil is 30 years old and married with three children who are in school, Rezil works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Rezil has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell

loans.name: Alymkan

texts.ru: Алымкан 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Алымкан - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Алымкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алымкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 лошадей, 50 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,50 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль, картофель и фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). Алымкан входит в группу "Таш-Тобо", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Алымкан является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алымкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Alymkan is 46 years old, married and raising five children together with her husband. Alymkan has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide additional income for her family, Alymkan is involved in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Alymkan's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 5 horses, 50 sheep and also a 1.50 hectare land plot, where she grows beans and potatoes. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). Alymkan is part of the "Tash-Tobo" group that includes two more persons. Alymkan is the third member of the group. In order to further develop her business, Alymkan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls to increase livestock headcount. Alymkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy bulls to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 41 years old and married with two children.

Maricris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Maricris has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income from frozen food.

Maricris aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ramses

texts.es: Ramses mayor de edad soltero con una hija aún bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y muy responsable en sus obligaciones como padre y como clientes, gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante  decide dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, donde ofrece productos como: shampoo, perfumenes, cremas, lápiz de ojo, lápiz labial, cremas de todo tipo, todo esto de las líneas de oriflame, Avon, Vogue , sus compras son al contado y al crédito, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, los cuales les ofrece productos al contado y al crédito recuperando estos semanal y quincenal, su forma de trabajar es de manera ambulante el cual sale desde muy temprano, para así cubrir su ruta diaria que el tiene, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a su hija siendo una profesional y que su negocio crezca. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio más en estas fechas próximas que las ventas son mayores.
texts.en: Ramses, an adult, is single, with a daughter for whom he is still responsible. He is originally from one of the towns of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. He is known to be a man who is honest, hard-working, and very responsible in his obligations as a father and with his customers. Thanks to his spirit and his will to succeed, he decided to work in the sale of cosmetics, where he offers products such as shampoo, perfumes, creams, eyeliner pencils, lipstick, and creams of all types; all these items are from the Oriflame, Avon, and Vogue lines. His purchases are for cash and on credit. He has regular and casual customers, to whom he offers products for cash and on credit, being repaid weekly and biweekly. His form of work is as a street vendor, for which he goes out very early, so that in this way he can cover his daily route. One of his dreams is to be able to see his daughter working in a career, and [another is] that his business grows. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business more for these upcoming dates when sales are greater.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as makeup, creams, perfumes, and shampoos, among other items

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Rhodora has been pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from her buy and sell ready to wear business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Begaiym

texts.ru: Бегайым 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Бегайым - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бегайым занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бегайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бык, 40 овец, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,50 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетнюю траву. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Бегайым входит в группу "Келечек -Калба", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Бегайым является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бегайым обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бегайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дома для среднего сына.
texts.en:
Begaiym is 47 and married with six children. She has a secondary education and raises animals as the primary source of her family's income, a business she started 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now contains two milk cows, one bull, 40 sheep, one horse and two calves as well as 3.5 hectares of arable land, on which she grows beans, potatoes and hay, with a total monthly income of 10,000 KGS.

Begaiym belongs to the group "Kelechek-Kalba", along with two other people. With the intention of further developing her farm, she has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 90,000 KGS to purchase heifers to increase her head count. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of her quantity of cattle, and plans to save toward building a house for her middle son.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Aysha's Group

texts.en:
Aysha is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of running a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, she has established a regular list of customers so that she makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She needs to deal with more customers regularly. To do this, she requires hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan through BRAC Pakistan. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the investment of the loan.

Aysha thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола родилась в 1966 года. Она разведена. Лола воспитывает одного несовершеннолетнего ребенка сама. Она работает в средней школе бухгалтером. Она имеет средне специальное образование и поэтому хочет получить высшее образование. Данное время она учится в университете по специальности бухгалтер и аудит. Она учится в заочное отделение. Лола должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она является повторной клиентом и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lola was born in 1966.  She is divorced, and raising a young boy who has yet to come of age all by herself.  She has the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training, and works at a secondary school as a bookkeeper.  She is currently taking classes at a university as a distance-learning student, hoping to eventually earn a degree in accounting with a focus on auditing, and is seeking a loan of 3,000 somoni to pay for her university tuition; this is not the first time she has taken a loan, and has a good record of paying them off in a timely manner.  She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: pay for her education

loans.name: Rapiysa

texts.ru: Рапийсе 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Рапийсы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рапийса занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рапийсы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 30 овец, 3 лошади, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). Рапийса входит в группу "Кызыл-Гул", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. Рапийса является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рапийса обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рапийса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Rapiysa is 55, married, and raising 4 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and raises livestock for a living, first starting 20 years ago with 10,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her farm currently has 2 dairy cows, 1 heifer, 30 sheep, 3 horses, and 2 calves, while her monthly income is 6,000 som.  Rapiysa, along with 2 other people, is forming a group called Kyzyl-Gul with her as the leader.  To further develop her farm, Rapiysa is seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy sheep.  She plans on reinvesting any extra money that the loan will allow her to make back into her farm by buying more livestock, as well as setting some of it aside for home repairs.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Gladis Ondina

texts.es:
Doña Gladis a sus 43 años sigue perseverando y luchando para cumplir cada uno de sus sueños, metas y esperanzas ya que de todo ello hay un poco. Ella es ama de casa y es madre de 6 hijos 4 se casaron y viven en hogares a parte y 2 aún viven con ella ayudando en todos los quehaceres del hogar y el campo que junto a su padre trabajan para salir adelante. Doña Gladis se considera una mujer fuerte y muy capaz ya que mientras no está la temporada de café ella trabaja en una empresa exportadora de café ya que de esa forma ella también hace clientes para su producto al final de cada cosecha. Las diferentes actividades sobre el rubro del café las practica desde su infancia ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar desde pequeña y la tierra que en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a 30 minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación. 
Sus metas son seguir incrementando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos; pero su sueño es poder seguir dando la oportunidad a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando y puedan graduarse convirtiéndose en profesionales y asegurando su futuro.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento con el cual comprara fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros insumos que ayudaran a que sus cultivos de café sean más productivos y más atractivos para sus clientes ya que el rubro del café es la actividad de ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Gladis, at the age of forty-three, continues persevering and striving to fulfill every one of her dreams, goals, and hopes, since she has a few of each. She is a homemaker and mother of six children. Four of her children got married and live in different homes. The other two still live with her, helping her with all of the housework and working with their father in the fields to get ahead. Gladis considers herself to be a strong and very capable woman, considering that when it's not the growing season for coffee, she works for a coffee exporting company; in this way she also gets new customers for her product at the end of each harvest. She's been practicing the various activities of the coffee business since her childhood, considering that it was her parents who taught her to work. The land that she works together with her partner and their children is her own; it is located at a distance of thirty minutes from her home. 

Her goals are to continue increasing her coffee fields by purchasing more land, strengthening her children's inheritance; however, her dream is to be able to continue providing for her children so that they can continue studying, and that they graduate and become professionals, securing their future. 

Therefore, today she is applying for a loan which she will use to buy fertilizers, manure, and foliar sprays, among other inputs, that will help her coffee fields be more productive and attractive to her customers since the coffee business is the source of income for her home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and weed her coffee fields.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
