Namita is a 40-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband Ramakanta is a mason whose income is not sufficient to cover their household expenses alone. That’s why Namita took the initiative to support her husband financially by cultivating broad beans. They have their own land. Because it’s a very in-demand seasonal vegetable, she decided to cultivate broad beans. She wants to use this loan for buying seeds and fertilizer for cultivation. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a car with the profits from her business.

Namita is a very ambitious lady who never wants to look back but wants to prosper in her life. She and her husband are very grateful to BJS and Kiva as they have extended their hand to help. She hopes Kiva & BJS will be beside her in her future days if she needs more assistance.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for cultivating beans

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a very determined 34-year-old with many dreams. She is a housewife from Dhupguri town and mother of five children, two of whom go to school, and the rest stay at home. She is illiterate, but knows how to sign her name. She is very determined that her children achieve a higher education, become a good citizen of the country and enhance their image of the country across the globe. 

She has land where she wants to cultivate potatoes and sell those potatoes in the markets. She is requesting this loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer to cultivate potatoes. To avoid contamination from insects and diseases she also wants to buy pesticides. The main difficulty she faces is the insects and diseases that affect the plants. She wants to prosper and create job opportunities for more people.

 She hopes Kiva and BJS will give her extensive support in the near future and produce a more helpful environment for her.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Mamoni

texts.en: Mamoni, 22, is raising her six children along with her husband Jakhir. She is illiterate but knows how to sign her name. She works as a daily laborer and her earnings are very low. Her husband has a cow-selling business, selling cows in the market. Unfortunately, their income is not enough to raise six children. Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and her family. So, she came to BJS for help and applied for a loan. With this loan, she wants to cultivate potatoes. In the future, with the profit she earns from her business, she wants to build a concrete house so that her children can have a better lifestyle. Mamoni hopes with the loan money she can manage to expand their business without any problems. She is thankful to Kiva and BJS for the loan. She has proven that it is not that difficult to see the light by overcoming hurdles if financial assistance is received.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man. He has owned an agricultural tractor on which he performs farming work, such as excavating the land to prepare it for cultivation. He works in dealing with many farmers and cultivators. 

Currently, Mohamad is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to equip his tractor with the needed supplies such as water tubes, sharp edge, etc. in order to be able to proceed with his work appropriately. He is very optimistic, and hopes to be able to further expand his business.

loans.use: to equip his tractor with the needed supplies such as water tubes, sharp edge, etc.

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and three children who are attending school. 10 years ago, he got involved in the plumbing business. And from time to time, he also does electrical repairs. He works on a freelance basis. 

With his loan requested from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., Abed will acquire new tools to be able to better serve his clients. This is his first Kiva loan, and he notes that he will be able to achieve remarkable growth thanks to it and will meet his objectives and therefore will satisfy his family’s needs.

loans.use: to acquire new tools to be able to better serve his clients.

loans.name: Dúo Bendicion De San Miguel Group

texts.es: Doña Cindy Johana ella tiene 26 años de edad y se dedica al cultivo de arveja china y ejote, y es agricultora de tipo mayorista, todos sus productos son entregados en la cooperativa de la localidad de San Miguel Milpas Altas, y es supervisada y capacitada a cada poco para mejorar su cultivo, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de repuesto de su carro ya que con ello trabaja a diario transportando su productos que cultiva su anhelo es mejorar su producto y de la misma forma superarse ella y su familia.
texts.en: Cindy Johana is 26, she grows peas and green beans, she is a wholesale farmer, all of her products are provided to a co-operative located in San Miguel Milpas Altas, she is supervised and trained to improve her crops, she is requesting a loan to buy repair parts for her car, which is something she works with daily to transport her products. Her dream is to improve her products and at the same time improve as an individual and as a family.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for her car where she transports vegetables.

loans.name: Insafa

texts.en:
Insafa a 49-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a carpenter by profession but his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 12 years, he also drives a taxi at night. 

Currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Insafa has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in future. 

Insafa desires to provide quality education to all her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Динары - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Динара занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 20 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,20 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль, картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Динара входит в группу "Кызыл-Гул", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Динара является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство хлева.
texts.en: Dinara is 31, married, and raising 3 children together with her husband. She has a university education, works as a teacher at a local school, and raises livestock to earn money on the side, first starting 10 years ago with 10,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her farm currently has 1 dairy cow and 20 sheep; additionally, she has 1.2 hectares' worth of land for growing beans, potatoes and rice, and her monthly income is about 8,000 som. Dinara, along with 2 other people, is forming a group called Kyzyl-Gul; she is the second member of the group.  To further develop her farm, Dinara is seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy sheep. She plans on reinvesting any extra money that the loan will allow her to make by buying more livestock, as well as setting some of it aside to build a shed to keep livestock in.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Tapana

texts.en:
Tapana, age 29, is a homemaker. She has completed secondary school (grade 12). Her husband Pradip, age 36, has completed his education through the B.A. She is from the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. Her husband is associated with the potato cultivation business. She is the mother of one child who is studying in class 2. Her husband’s income is insufficient for the family's growth. So she decided to earn more money and help her husband. They have their own land, which is near their home. She wants to do cultivation on that land so she can earn something for her family. Due to the lack of finances, she couldn’t do any business on that land. So she decided to take a loan to buy potato seeds and pay labor and irrigation cost of potato cultivation. She decided to do this business because in her small town, this business is very profitable and even her husband has knowledge about this business.

Her dream is to improve the financial condition of their family so that her child does not suffer for anything in the future and they can live happily throughout their life. She is a hardworking woman who is educated about the importance of this business. She is very thankful that BJS and Kiva are funding her loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and pay for labor and irrigation cost of cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Augusto tem 37 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 5 filhos todos a estudar, vive na casa própria e trabalha como operário nos caminhos de ferro.
Com o valor do crédito quer comprar cimento, ferro, barrotes, chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a sua obra. 
Seu plano para o futuro é fazer dependências para arrendar reforçando assim a sua renda familiar.
Diz que irá pagar o mais rápido possίvel para voltar a solicitar mais crédito para a realização de seus projectos.
texts.en:
Augusto is 37 years old. He is married and the father of five children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own home and works on the railroad.
He will use the loan to buy cement, rebar, beams, and sheet metal to continue his construction project.
His plan for the future is to build rental properties to supplement his family income.
He says that he will pay off the loan as quickly as possible so he can request more to pursue his projects.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, beams, and sheet metal.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Alexandre, de 26 anos de idade, casado, vive na sua própria casa. Tem um filho sem idade escolar, gestor de stock há quatro anos.
O dinheiro de empréstimo, será aplicado na compra de material de construção como: cimento, varrões, barrotes e pregos para dar a continuidade com a sua obra.
Tem como sonhos  ampliar a sua casa e  fazer mais empréstimo para fazer muro d vedacao.
texts.en:
Alexandre is 26 years old. He is married and lives in his own home. He has a young son who does not yet attend school. He has been a stock manager for four years.
He will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, rebar, beams, and nails to continue his construction project.
His dream is to expand his house and get another loan to build a wall around it.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, beams, and nails.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 65 years old. She is married with two children. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past year before joining extensive farming of growing maize so that she can sell in large quantities. Her previous business was primarily for home consumption use, but so far after joining this maize farming she expects more returns compared to the previous small business. For this new loan, she wants the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production; she needs to buy more fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming he wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Florien

texts.en: Florien is aged 47. He is married and has six children. He sells various items in his shop and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, he wants to add more other merchandise such as sugar and rice for resale. He plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el Distrito de La Matanza, a dos horas de la ciudad de Morropon, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivos de algarrobo, ubicado en la costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte, trasladando a sus clientes a zonas aledañas a su comunidad, eventualmente se desempeña como maestro de construción,son una familia unida su esposa le apoya en la labor de venta de animales menores.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tener una mejor produciión para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 43, lives with his family in the district of La Matanza, two hours from the city of Morropon, where its population's activity is the trade of small animals and farming land with carob trees, located in the North Coast of Peru.

He provides transportation services, taking customers from nearby areas to his community, he also works as a construction worker. He has a very close family, his wife supports him by helping in the trade of small animals.

He is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy feed, and this way have better products to offer his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Ifashe Group

texts.fr:
Hyacinthe fait partie du groupe Ifashe et habite à Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à Roger, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce de bananes et de bière de banane depuis  16 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-septième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle assure les besoins fondamentaux de la famille (alimentation, logement et les soins de santé) et elle a déjà acheté un terrain.
texts.en:
Hyacinthe is a member of the Ifashe group and lives in Gitega. She is 43 years old and married to Roger, a shopkeeper. Together they have 6 children. She has been in the business of selling bananas and banana beer for 16 years. She is on her seventeenth loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that she obtains, Hyacinthe will increase her business capital and purchase bananas in bulk for resale in order to increase her earnings. With the profit from her business, she provides for the fundamental needs of her family (food, housing, and health needs) and has already been able to purchase some land.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase bananas in bulk for resale, to increase her earnings

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old. She is a mother of six children. She would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yams and sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more ladies' and gents' wear to sell to customers

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of two successful entrepreneurs, one of whom is Comfort, 44, who is single and has had a food joint (chop bar) for 12 year. She needs the loan to buy products, such as rice, vegetable ingredients, fish, meat, cassava, plantain, etc. cook and sell to customers.

Paul, 39, sells shoes.

This is their 13th loan cycle with ID-Ghana, and they need a total amount of GHS 3,900 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy products, such as rice, vegetable ingredients, fish, meat, cassava, plantain, etc. to cook and sell to customers.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
A senhora Arminda é negociante há mais de cinco de anos. Ela tem 43 anos de idade vive na casa própria, casada e mãe de três filhos estudantes no nivel primario.
Com o crédito financiado pela Hluvuku vai  comprar material de construcao  como: areia, cimento, pedras, para fabrico de blocos para revenda.
No futuro, pretende comprar máquina eléctrica de fabrico de blocos vibrados e, o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo o mais rápido possivel para poder realizar os seus programas dentro dos seus planos.
texts.en:
Arminda has had her own business for more than five years. She is 43 years old and lives in her own home. She is married and has three children who are in elementary school.
She will use the loan from Hluvuku to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone to make cinder blocks to resell.
In the future, she would like to buy a machine that makes cinder blocks, and her greatest challenge is to repay this loan as quickly as possible so she can carry out the rest of her plans.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and stone to make cinder blocks to resell.

loans.name: Abdou Kadre  Zeidane

texts.fr:
Abdou  est un homme de 33 ans qui s’active dans la vente de  bétails depuis plus de 05 ans. Il fait aussi de l’élevage de vaches. Abdou n’a pratiquement pas eu besoin de recourir à une quelconque mutuelle pour y emprunter de l’argent. Mais vu présentement  qu’il a envie de plus développer son activité, il sollicite un crédit de 200.000F CFA  pour acheter une grande quantité d’aliments bétails.
Il a comme charges : de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de son foyer (car il est marié et père de 5 enfants) ; mais aussi de s’occuper de ses bêtes pour pouvoir les revendre. Il veut davantage augmenter son cheptel
texts.en: Abdou is a 33-year-old man who has been involved with selling livestock for over five years. He is also involved in raising cattle. Abdou had practically no need to turn to some mutual fund in order to borrow money. But now he wants to further his business, he is asking for a 200,000 CFA loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of livestock feed. He is responsible for meeting his household's daily needs (as he is married and a father to five children), but he also needs to care for his animals in order to resell them. He also wants to increase his herd's numbers.

loans.use: to purchase livestock destined for resale

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.pt:
O Senhor jossefa tem tres filhos dos quais um vive em casa dos seus avos e estuda.Tem  46 anos de idade, casado e trabalhador da Saúde há 23 anos,  e trabalha em turnos.
O dinheiro do emprestimo será aplicado na compra de produtos como: cerveja, refrescos e outros produtos para revenda no seu estabelecimento. 
o seu princinpal desafio é controlar o seu negocio, visto que  pratica  junto com a sua esposa e diz que ira pedir mais credito para comprar de electrodomesticos.
texts.en:
Joseffa has three children, two of whom live with their grandparents and go to school. He is 46 years old. He is married and has been a health worker for 23 years. He works in shifts.
He will use this loan to buy beer, soft drinks, and other products to resell in his business.
His main challenge is to manage his business, which he and his wife run together, and he says that he plans to request another loan to buy some home appliances.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Oumar est un homme d’une quarantaine d’année qui évolue dans l’embouche, il a une expérience de 6ans dans son activité. Oumar est marié et père de famille qui gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Il demande ce  prêt d’un montant de 400.000F pour acheter du bétail qu’il vend à ses clients. Il commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer jà 17h. Il souhaite à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Oumar is a man in his forties who works in livestock fattening, of which he has six years of experience. Oumar is a married father who manages his family's daily expenditures and pays for his children's school fees. He is asking for a 40,000 XOF loan to purchase cattle which he will resell to his clients. He starts his day at 9 AM and finishes at 5 PM. In the future, he hopes to increase his revenue in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock destined for resale

loans.name: Magara Group

texts.fr:
Vincent fait partie du groupe  Magara et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 41 et est marié à Caritas. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 7 à 15 ans, dont 3 étudient. 
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants qui étudient, membres de la famille élargie

Il fait le commerce de beignets depuis 14 ans. 

C’est premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter 8 sacs de farine pour avoir beaucoup de beignets à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter une moto et  voir ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en:
Vincent is a member of the Magara group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 41 years old and is married to Caritas. Together, they have four children between the ages of 7 and 15. Three of them go to school. He has two dependent children who go to school who are members of the extended family. 

He has been selling beignets for 14 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a lot of flour (8 sacks) so that he can have a lot of beignets that he can resell to earn more.

In the next few years, he would like to buy a motorbike and see his children finish their schooling.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a lot of flour (8 sacks).

loans.name: Saphaniah

texts.en: Saphaniah is 48 years old, is married, and supports six members of his family. He runs a carpentry shop in Kapsabet town, served by the KADET Kapsabet office. He has been in business for the last seven years; he gets an average monthly income of KShs 120,000. He plans to use the amount borrowed of KShs 30,000 to buy timber for his carpentry shop. He will reinvest the profits from the business. His dream is to grow his business to higher levels of profitability and also create employment.

loans.use: To buy timber for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: MARIAMA est une femme qui habite aux environs du Guichet. Elle est à son 1er prêt . C’est une femme battante, qui s’active dans le commerce depuis  plus de 7ans. Elle a d’abord démarré son activité au marché de la place, ou elle vendait du poisson et des légumes. En rentrant chez elle  après le travail, elle était sollicitée par le voisinage  pour certains condiments qui restaient qu’elle ramenait à la maison. Finalement c’est là que lui est venue l’idée de s’installer devant chez elle pour y dresser une table, et d’y vendre la même chose c'est à dire les poissons et légumes. Comme ca elle pourra récupérer  toute la clientèle du quartier. Elle commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer vers les environs de 14h. A l’avenir elle souhaite agrandir son activité et augmenter ses revenus
texts.en: Mariama is a woman living near the CAURIE branch office. This is her first loan. She is a real fighter who has been involved in her business for over seven years. She first started her business in the market place, where she sold fish and vegetables. After returning home after work, her neighbours came to her asking for certain leftover foodstuffs which she brought back with her. Finally, this is when the idea came to her to set up a stall in front of her house and to sell the same produce. This way, she would be able to win over all the customers in the local area. She starts her days at 6 AM and finishes around 2 PM. In the future, she hopes to be able to build herself a house.

loans.use: to buy and sell fresh fish and vegetables

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rita works hard to support her family.
She has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Rita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell for her business.
Rita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 28 years old and married with two children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, etc., to sell.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 33 years old and married with four children.

Juanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Juanita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 57 years old. He is married to Salome and is a father of four children. He lives with one of his children. He runs a hotel business in Limuru and has been in this business for 15 years now. He gets a monthly income of 63,000 Kenyan shillings.
This will be Edward's fifth loan with Kadet Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a new freezer and also use some money to buy foodstuff in bulk. In the future, he wants to buy a plot and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy another freezer and foodstuff for his hotel business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old and married to Grace. Together they are blessed with one child, aged 1 year.

He has a business of supplying breads and cakes in Naivasha that he has been running for five years. He has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to buy stock, i.e. breads and cakes, so as to meet his customers' demand. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to prosper in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy breads and cakes for sale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest family challenge to be water shortage. She will use the 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy a water tank and add stock of clothes for resale. Her family will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a boutique. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use and add stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Sally works very hard to provide for them.

Sally runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, spices, etc.

Sally has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married with seven children. She helped her husband in managing their transportation services business, carrying passengers and baggage in their community, to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years and had plans to acquire another unit for expansion. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to pay for motorcycle maintenance costs. In the future, she wants to have a stable source of income for the better living of her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 51 years old and is married to Timothy. She supports nine members of her family. She has been in the tea hawking business for the last 33 years, earning a monthly income of KShs 42,000. She operates her business in Kaptumo and is served by the KADET Kapsabet office. She has borrowed KShs 60,000 and plans to buy tea leaves for sale. She will use the profits from the business to provide the basic needs of food and clothing for her family. Her dream is to own her own tea processing business.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 60 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sardines, soft drinks, soap and other miscellaneous items.

In the future Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 28 years old, married to Simon, and together they are blessed with two children aged eight and four.

She has a cosmetics business in Naivasha, which she has been running for two years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy a stock of beauty products. She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to grow her business and also own a house.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa runs a general store in their community to earn a living. She has been doing this for fifteen years and she earns enough to provide her family's daily needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional grocery goods for sale. She is hoping to sustain her business to have a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale.

loans.name: Twegere Group

texts.fr:
Daniel  fait partie du groupe  Twegere et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 26 et est marié à Estelle. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 2 ans. 
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant  qui étudie, membre de sa famille élargie.

Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis 14 ans. 

C’est premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 6 douzaines d’habits,  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et  voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the Twegere Group and lives in Bubanza. He is 26 and is married to Estelle. Together they have one two-year-old child. Daniel also cares for a child from his extended family who is studying.

Daniel has been a clothing merchant for the past 14 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With the loan he receives from KIVA, he plans to increase his capital and buy six dozen sets of clothing that he will sell to earn more income.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy six dozen sets of clothing that he will sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 60 years old and married.

She earns a living as a fish cage operator in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional nets and feed for her fish.

Thelma has been a fish cage operator for nine years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets and feed for her fish.

loans.name: Kigwati Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kigwati est composé de 10 femmes et 6 hommes ,sur la photo Emmanuel est représentée par sa femme Concilie.
Espérance  est le chef du groupe  Kigwati et  habite à Rumonge. Elle a 35 et est mariée à Gérard. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 2 à 14 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Elle fait le commerce de bière de sorgho et de banane  depuis  13 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes et une grande quantité de sorgho pour préparer les 2 bières respectives, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait faire de l'agriculture de pomme de terre et de haricot;  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
The Kigwati Group consists of ten women and six men, and in the photo the member Emmanuel is represented by his wife Concilie.

Espérance is the leader of the Kigwati Group and lives in Rumonge. She is 35 and is married to Gérard. Together they have five children aged two to 14 years old, four of whom are studying. She has been a merchant of sorghum beer and bananas for the past 13 years.

This is her first loan with Turame. With the loan she receives from KIVA, Espérance plans to increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas and a large quantity of sorghum to prepare two types of beer, which she will sell to earn more income. In the coming years, Espérance would like to begin farming potatoes and beans. She also wants to see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas and a large quantity of sorghum to prepare two types of beer, which she will sell to earn more income

loans.name: Jypariza

texts.ru: Жыпаризе 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Жыпаризы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жыпариза занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жыпаризы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,96 ГА, на которой выращивает фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Жыпариза входит в группу "Кызыл-Гул", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Жыпариза является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпариза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жыпариза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Jypariza is 27 years old, she is married and is raising two children with her husband. She has secondary education and does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family, which she started five years ago with the purchase of livestock for 12,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Jypariza now has in her livestock one milk cow, fifteen sheep and also a plot of land in the size of 0.96 hectares where she grows beans and potatoes. Her monthly income is 5,000 som. Jypariza is a member of the Kyzyl-Gul group with two more members. Jypariza is a third member in the group. With the purpose to further grow her business she has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy a cow and increase the headcount of livestock. Jypariza plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of livestock and plans to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.es:
Doroteo tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en Pomahuaca que se caracteriza por un clima cálido, cultivo de frutales, que pertenece a Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Tiene una pequeña bodeguita ofreciendo venta de abarrotes, también de dedica a la venta de fruta de estación, en los mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo, adicionalmente brinda el servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes de Pomahuaca a los caseríos aledaños.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de abarrotes, arroz, leche , menestras y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Doroteo is 55 years old. He lifes with his wife and children in Pomahuaca, a district characterized by a warm climate and the cultivation of fruit. Pomahuaca belongs to the province of Jaén in the northern mountains of Peru.

Doroteo has a small grocery store where he sells foodstuff. He also sells fruits of the season in the markets of the city of Chiclayo and in addition he offers transportation services with his mototaxi, taking his customers from Pomahuaca to the neighboring villages.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles which he wants to use to buy foodstuff, rice, milk, and legumes, in order to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff like rice, milk, legumes to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 44 años de edad, vive en su casa propia en Morropon a dos horas de Piura costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de limón y lo distribuye en las picanterías de su zona, adicionalmente Ella también vende comida preparada en su domicilio es muy conocida por el buen sabor que ofrece en cada plato preparado.

María ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglos en su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar atractivo y agradable para acoger a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Elena is 44 years old. She lives in her own home in Morropon, two hours from Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

She has worked for three years selling lemons, distributing them to restaurants in her area. She also sells prepared meals from her house. She is well known for the good food she offers in every dish she prepares.  

María has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to do some home repair so she can have an attractive and pleasing place to receive customers.

loans.use: to fix up her business locale local where she sells prepared meals.

loans.name: Tania Vaneza

texts.es: La Sra. Tania tiene 26 años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 6 y8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos varios,  electrodomésticos  también celulares, cargadores, accesorios, etc. Ella vive en la zona de  Villa Adela,  este préstamo este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios de celulares por mayor su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tienen  pedidos de sus clientes, la Sra. Tania enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de capital,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tania is 26 years old and has two children, who are 6 and 8 years old. She works selling various products, amongst others electrical applicances, cell phones, chargers, accessories, etc. She lives in the neighborhood of Villa Adela.

This loan is her first cycle with the institution. She will use the loan to buy wholesale cell phone accessories. The reason she is applying for the loan is that she has orders from her clients.

Tania faces obstacles with her business due to the lack of capital. She will use the profits to make her business grow. Her wish for her business is to generate more income in order to be able to provide economically for her family and by this to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cell phones for selling.

loans.name: Luis  Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 36 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 9 y 5 años,  él se dedica  a la confección  de estuches de cámara de todo tipo, su taller se encuentra en la zona de Vino Tinto, este préstamo es su primera secuencias dentro de la institución, El Sr. Luis va a usar este préstamo para compra de material como cuero para la confección de sus estuches, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tiene un  pedido muy grande, El Sr. Luis enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia del mercado. El Sr. Luis va a utilizar los beneficios teniendo una mayor producción su deseo para  su negocio es tener un taller más grande y así mejorar su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Luis is 36 years old. He is married and has 2 children, aged 9 and 5. He makes camera cases of all types. His workshop is located in the Vino Tinto area. This loan is his first cycle in the institution. Luis is going to use this loan to buy material like leather to make his cases. His reason for asking for this loan is that he has a very large order. Luis faces challenges in his business, which are competition in the market. Luis is going to use the profits to have more production. What he wants for his business is to have a bigger workshop and thus improve production and his income.

loans.use: to buy leather to make cases for different cameras.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en Chilcal, una zona rural de Oyotun a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene una familia unida, su hijo le apoya en la labor que realiza cría y venta de animales menores, cerdos, patos y gallinas su negocio esta ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, son muy conocidos en la zona y tienen clientela fija.

Oscar ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de su vivienda, compra de ventanas y puertas y de esta manera tener un hogar más seguro donde residir.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old and lives together with his son in Chilcal, located in a rural area called Oyotun, two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, in the northern coast of Peru.

All his family members have a close relation. His son helps him to raise farm animals such as pigs, ducks and hens. He runs his business in his backyard. He is well-known locally and has a good, fixed customer base.

Oscar has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to make some home improvements. He will buy windows and doors in order to have a safer house where to live.

loans.use: to make some home improvements, and buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Glenda Lismenia

texts.es: Glenda, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, inicio su negocio hace cuatro años, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de librería y miscelánea, ropa y zapatos, ella desea obtener un crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos porque  ya se acerca la época navideña para ofrecerles a sus clientes diversidad de productos, y así obtener más ganancias de las que regularmente obtiene, ella desea tener un negocio más grande y sabe que lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo diario, le gusta mucho trabajar con fape y kiva por las oportunidades que la institución le proporciona esperando que ustedes le puedan seguir ayudando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Glenda is married and has two children. She started her business four years ago and sells stationary, various other articles, and also clothes and shoes.

She would like to take out a credit to invest in the purchase of clothes and shoes. As the holiday season is approaching, she wants to offer her customers a variety of products in order to make more profit than she usually does. She wants to have a bigger business and knows that she can achieve this by working hard every day.

She enjoys working with FAPE and Kiva because of the opportunities the institutions provide for her and she hopes that they can continue to help her with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for her store.

loans.name: Apolonia Lindomery

texts.es:
Apolonia Lindomery tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona urbana de Mocupe, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega de abarrotes, Apolonia es una mujer emprendedora y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de golosinas, bebidas refrescantes y frutas y así tener que ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Apolonia Lindomery is 51 years old. She lives with her husband in a small community in the urban area of Mocupe, whose population is dedicated to farming and trade. 

She has a small grocery store. Apolonia is an entrepreneurial woman and has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to stock her business by purchasing candies, drinks and fruit and, in this way, offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy candies, fruit and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Neptali

texts.es:
Neptalí tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará caracterizada por un clima caluroso, su población se dedica al comercio de frutales, ganadería y transporte, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaen, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca.

El brinda servicio de trasporte trasladando en su mototaxi a sus clientes a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, son una familia que se esfuerza por tener un mejor futuro, su esposa le apoya en la labor de crianza y venta de animales menores.

Neptalí ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de aves de corral gallinas y pavos para ofrecerlos a mejor precio en el mercado de la zona y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Neptalí is 24 years old. He lives with his wife and their children in the district of Pucara, which is known for its hot climate. Its population is dedicated to fruit trade, cattle and transportation. It is two hours from the city of Jaen located in the Cajamarca region.

He provides transportation services transferring his customers in his mototaxi to villages surrounding his community. They are a family that works hard to have a better future. His wife supports him in his work raising and selling young animals.

Neptali has requested a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the purchase of poultry - chicken and turkey - to offer at a better price in the area's market and, in this way, have better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El Sr. Jhonny tiene 28 años, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como también venta de leche él vive en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Jhonny va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado lechero para crianza por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  el Sr. Jhonny enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para sus ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción de leche, el  Sr. Jhonny es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jhonny is 28 years old. He is dedicated to purchasing and selling cattle as well as selling milk. He lives in the town of Batallas. This loan is his first with this institution. Jhonny is going to use this loan to buy dairy cows to raise for his business. His reason for requesting this loan is to improve his income. Jhonny faces challenges in his business which include improving his business and quality of life and he is going to utilize the benefits to buy balanced feed for his cattle and, in this way, be able to have better milk production. Jhonny is a young person with a desire to get ahead. He feels happy for this opportunity provided to him to improve his business and hence his income.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle to raise.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 28 years old and married to Ziporah. Together they are blessed with one child.

Peter has a barber shop business in Naivasha, which he has been running for three years. He has applied for his fist loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to purchase a chair and shaving device for his barber shop. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his business.

In the near future, Peter hopes to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a chair and shaving device for his barber shop.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 58 años de edad vive junto a su familia en Cayaltí, su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Son una familia emprendedora que se dedican al servicio de fotocopiado, muy conocidos en zona por el buen servicio que brindan, Oswaldo ha solcitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de material de escritorio papel bond, lapiceros, folders, grapas enre otros para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 58 years old. He lives with his family in Cayalti. Its population is dedicated to trade, farming and raising livestock.

They are an entrepreneurial family who are dedicated to photocopy services and are very well known in the area for the good service they provide. Oswaldo has requested a loan of 2500 PEN to invest in the purchase of stationery materials: bond paper, pens, folders, staples, among others to stock his business and, in this way, generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy stationery material like bond paper, pens and folders for his business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business. She fattens pigs in the Philippines. Victoria has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been fattening pigs for 12 years now, and she has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwagandi

texts.en:
Mwagandi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives along the coastal region of Kenya. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwagandi has operated a cafe business, serving items such as rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as a major challenge.

With the KES 20,000, Mwagandi wants to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to obtain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Dúo Mixco Group

texts.es: Dúo Mixco, este duo esta conformado por la señora Mirtala de 42 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo desde hace 20 años, ya que es una actividad muy rentable por la demanda de los clientes que ella tiene, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de carne de pollos para la venta, solicita el credito ya que sus clientes han aumentado y con el capital que tiene no le alcanza, esperando la oportunidad de su ayuda, el anhelo de ella es tener un local aun mas grande del que posee actual mente para mejora la vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Dúo Mixco: This duo is made up of Mirtala who is 42 years old. She has been dedicated to selling chicken for twenty years since it's a very profitable activity due to the demand of the customers she has. At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy chicken meat to sell. She is requesting the loan since her customer base has increased and the capital that she has is not enough. In anticipation of your help, her goal is to have a shop even bigger than the one she possesses currently to improve her and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela tiene 23 años tiene dos hijos que, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa según la temporada la Sra. Daniela vive en la Localidad de Puerto Rico, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la compra de pantalones por mayor,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tienen  pedidos de sus clientes, la Sra. Daniela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de capital,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniela is 23 years old. She has two children. She is dedicated to selling a variety of clothing, depending on the season. Daniela lives in the town of Puerto Rico. This loan is her first with the institution. She is going to use the loan to buy trousers at wholesale. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she has orders from her customers. Daniela faces challenges with her business that include a lack of capital and she is going to use the benefits to grow the business. Her wish for her business is to have greater income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy trousers at wholesale.

loans.name: Ibidou

texts.fr: Âgée de 29ans, madame Ibidou est mariée et mère de 02 enfants de 06 et 03ans scolarisés. Elle a appris la coiffure et en 2002 a ouvert son atelier dans lequel il exerce son activité. En plus de son service rendu, elle revend des mèches à ses clientes. C'est pour augmenter son stock qu'elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Elle espère réinjecter son profit dans l'activité et assurer la bonne scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ibidou, age 29, is married and the mother of two school-attending children, age 6 and 3. She got trained as a hairdresser. In 2002, she opened the workshop where she runs her business.

In addition to her hairdressing services, she also sells hair extensions to her customers. She's seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to increase her stock.

She hopes to re-inject her profits in her business, and ensure a proper education for her children.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 13 décembre 2008, ce groupe progresse grâce à l'élan de solidarité qui tourne autour des membres qui font comme principale activité le petit commerce. 
Oumy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 filles. Elle fait comme activité principale le petit commerce. Elle vend de la glace, de la crème glacée, du beurre de karité et de l'eau de javel. Elle développe cette activité au niveau de sa localité et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle va acheter du pain de singe à 40 000 F et 07 bassine de bissap à 3000 F la bassine soit 21 000 F pour la crème glacée, payer l'électricité à 80 000 F et avec les 60 000 F qui reste elle va acheter du beurre de karité, de l'eau de javel et des sachets pour confectionner la glace.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was inaugurated on December 13, 2008 and moves forward thanks to the solidarity drive between its members. Their main business is retail.

Oumy is the woman standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's 51 years old, married, and the mother of six children, out of whom four are girls.

Her main business is retail. She sells ice, ice cream, shea butter, and bleach. She runs her business in her village, and has a good experience in this field.

She will buy monkey bread (baobab tree fruit) for XOF 40'000 and seven basins of hibiscus for XOF 21'000 to make ice cream. XOF 80'000 will be used to cover the electricity bill, and with the remaining XOF 60'000, she will buy shea butter, bleach, and bags to make ice.

With her profits, she will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy monkey bread (baobab tree fruit), hibiscus, shea butter, and bleach

loans.name: Gorety

texts.en:
Gorety is 45 years old, married to Gideon, and together they are blessed with four children who are in school.

She has a boutique business in Naivasha which she has been running for six years. 

She has applied for her fifth loan from Kadet Ltd to purchase a stock of clothes to sell.

Her previous loan had a positive impact, which led to the expansion of her business. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest boutique in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Char

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Char works hard to support her family. She has a handicraft business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Char is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, etc. for her handicraft business.

Char has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Ricarda es una señora emprendedora de 32 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos, ella curso primaria completa. Sus hijos el mayor cursa la primaria, el segundo estudia en kínder y el menor de todos el cual pasa en casa ya que no tiene la edad para estudiar ni en pre kínder aun. Ricarda desde muy temprana edad le gusto la agricultura, al cultivo de café, también siembran maíz, frijoles para el consumo de su familia y comercializa la piña. Ella y su esposo tienen mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que juntos han sabido ser uno solo para los negocios, para los trabajos de campo caminando 3 kilómetros diariamente para poder asistir sus cultivos ya que en su familia el motor principal de sus ingresos es el rubro del café. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra siendo ellos mismos quienes le heredaran la tierra que hoy día trabajan junto a sus esposo involucrándose en las diferentes actividades a realizar ellos dos únicamente.
Por lo que ella hoy en día necesita financiamiento para la compra de 2 sacos de abono foliar, 2 sacos de urea, 2 sacos de abono 18-46-0, 2 sacos de nutricafe, un litro de ALTO 10 SL, 2 sacos de formula cafetalera y 2 sacos de abono 12-24-12 con lo que podrá asistir sus cultivos de café para esta temporada. 
Ricarda sueña en un futuro ampliar sus cultivos de café, darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, ya que ella en su niñez tubo muchas limitaciones y no desea que ellos vivan la misma situación, además ansía brindarles educación universitaria para que ellos sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro confiando que sus hijos le ayudaran económicamente en su vejez. Estos planes consideran que los lograra mejorando sus tierras para obtener excelentes cosechas y por ende generar mayores ingresos para su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Ricarda, 32, is an enterprising woman.  She's married and the mother of three children.  She completed elementary school.  Her older children are in elementary school: the oldest is in elementary school, the second one's in kindergarten, and the youngest is at home because he's too young to attend school, even pre-kindergarten.

Ricarda liked farming from a young age.  She produces coffee, and also grows corn and beans for family consumption, and she sells pineapple.  She and her husband have a lot of experience in this job because they have learned to work together as one for the business.

She walks three kilometers every day to take care of her crops.  Her family is the main motivation for her income and her area is coffee.  Her parents taught her to farm and gave her the land that she and her husband now farm.  The two of them alone do the various tasks.

This is why Ricarda currently needs a loan to buy one liter of Alto SL and two bags each of foliar soil amendments, urea, 18-46-0 soil amendments, Nutricafé, coffee formula, and 12-24-12 soil amendments.  With these products she'll be able to take care of her coffee plants for the season.

Ricarda dreams of expanding her coffee crop and giving her children better living conditions in the future.  She had a lot of limitations during her childhood and doesn't want them to be in the same situation.  She also wants them to have a college education so they'll be professionals and have a better future.  She trusts her children will help her financially in her old age.

Ricarda believes she'll realize these goals by improving her land to get excellent harvests and, consequently, generate the additional income that her household needs so much.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa,soltera originaria del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, turismo, sus hermosas playas entre otras mas bellezas, se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora que no le teme al trabajo, se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa interior, cosméticos, zapatos, chineria, prendas de oro, y otros por encargos, ella realiza sus compras en otros municipios, los cuales son al contado, ella distribuye su mercadería a comerciantes de distintos municipios del país principalmente de occidente, los cuales tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, este negocio ya son varios años de tenerlo, el cual lo inicia como un medio de subsistencia para salir adelante, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar mas su negocio y así lograr salir adelante, al igual que poder comprar su propia casa. el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo, en la compra de mercadería como: zapatos, diferentes estilo de ropa, cosméticos, entre otros por lo que su demanda creció mas y por la proximidad de las fechas navideñas.-
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is single and from the municipality of Chinandega in the west of the country. This area has very much commerce and tourism and beautiful spots, like its lovely beaches.

Maria Luisa is characterized as a responsible and hard-working woman who is not afraid of hard work. She earns her living buying and selling various merchandise, for example lingerie, cosmetics, shoes, knick-knacks, gold jewelry, and more items ordered by her customers.

She makes her purchases in other municipalities paying in cash and then distributes her merchandise to traders of different municipalities of the country, mainly in the west, where she has regular and temporary customers. She has had this business for many years already and started it as a means to make a living. One of her dreams is to be able to increase her business and by this to get ahead, and also to buy her own house.

The objective of her loan is to obtain working capital for the purchase of merchandise, such as shoes, different styles of clothing, cosmetics, and more, as the demand has risen because Christmas is near.

loans.use: to get working capital to invest in her business and to stock general merchandise, like different styles of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and more.

loans.name: Kandoro Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her mid 20s, has one daughter who goes to school.  She has been running a business of selling 'bites' like chapati, mandazi and samosas for two years now. She works from 6.00 am to 12 noon (for six hours only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her stock of baking flour, cooking oil, charcoal, Irish potatoes, onions and carrots.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and for household expenses.  She will use this loan to  buy more baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal to make more 'bites' to sell to more people.  She dreams of owning a restaurant.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group "KANDORO" with nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal for making more 'bites' to sell

loans.name: Dúo Lupita De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Lupita de San Mateo
Este dúo está conformado por doña María, ella tiene 36 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas los tres tiempos en su  domicilio ubicado en la aldea san Mateo Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de un comal industrial grande, y para compra de maíz, su deseo es poner otro local de tortillas ya que gracias a dios tiene mucha demanda y por tal motivo necesita capital para aperturar otro local, desde ya les agradese por su ayuda ya que por el area donde ella vive hay mucha gente que se ha superado en gran manera gracias a los credito de kiva es por esa razon que ella solicita la ayuda de kiva para superarse en su negocio.
texts.en:
Duo Lupita de San Mateo

This duo includes Maria, who is 36 years old and works selling tortillas for breakfast, lunch and dinner from her home in the small village of San Mateo Milpas Altas.  She is requesting a loan to buy a large industrial griddle, and to buy corn.  She would like to have another sales location, because thanks to God there is much demand for her product.  For this reason she needs capital to open the other location.  She is grateful for your help, because there are many people in the area where she lives who have excelled greatly due to Kiva loans. This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva, in order to excel in her business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle and to buy corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en: Phung would like to take a further loan to buy materials for making plastic laminated items. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Perla se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Perla trabaja en un centro textil de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Perla se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará los materiales de estudios que necesita que necesita, como separatas, libros, folletos y otros, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Perla is a 21-year-old woman, she is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. She is very hard-working, enthusiastic and devotes all her efforts to getting ahead. Thanks to her efforts and the help of her parents, Perla is studying a professional career.

On her own initiative, Perla works in a tailor's shop in her city. She works for approximately eight hours each day and she thinks she is doing well because of her dedication and good performance.

Perla is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help she will buy the study materials she needs, like printouts, books, brochures, and more, so that she can continue to work and to strive to achieve her dream of becoming a working professional.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es una joven muy emprendedora y luchadora de 25 años de edad, soltera y sin ninguna dependencia (Hijos) con un grado educativo de secundaria cursando el plan básico en su totalidad la cual aún vive con sus padres y hermanos. Sonia se dedica a la agricultura ya que en su familia es una tradición especializándose en la caficultura y la elaboración de viveros desde hace más de 10 años siendo sus clientes los vecinos y amigos, intermediarios que llegan a la zona y demás. Sus cultivos de café se encuentran ubicados a 5 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación  al cual se trasladan en autobús en compañía de sus hermanos y sus padres para poder asistir la plantación y vivero ya que como una familia dedicada a la caficultura se involucran todos en este rubro.  
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos de café sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad y de esta forma poder obtener mayores ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. Pero su más grande anhelo es seguir estudiando poder ingresar a la universidad y preparase académicamente en una carrera que pueda implementar en lo que ella mejor hace y poder llevar mejores y nuevas técnicas o estrategias para seguir creciendo
Por lo que ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así poder dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café comprando abono, fertilizantes, foliares, urea, entre otros y poder empezar a dar paso a su más grande sueño mediante las ganancias obtenidas.
texts.en:
Sonia is a young, persistent and enterprising woman. She is 25 years old, single and has no children. She finished high school, reaching a basic level of education. She still lives with her parents and siblings.

Sonia works in agriculture, which is a tradition in her family. She specializes in growing coffee and building greenhouses and has been doing so for more than ten years. Her clients are neighbors and friends, middle men, etc. Her coffee plantations are located five km [around three miles] from where she lives, so she, her siblings and her parents take a bus and work together growing coffee.

Her dream is to expand her plantations in the future in order to produce more and receive a higher income to get ahead with her family. However, her biggest dream is to continue studying and make it to the university, so she can have a professional carrier. This way, she could apply her knowledge doing what she does best and would be able to bring the best practices and the newest techniques and strategies to continue growing.

For this, she needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies in order to take care of her coffee plantations. She will buy compost, fertilizers, foliar spray, urea and other supplies she needs. With the profits she will make, she will take the first step towards the fulfillment of her biggest dream.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined and confident. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea for sale. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to clean water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have access to clean water. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy water storage equipment

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica  is 43 years old, widowed  and she provides for eight members of her family. She has been in the tea-selling business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kshs.5,000. She operates her business in Chemundu center and is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. She has borrowed Ksh.15,000 and plans to use part of it to purchase tea leaves for sale and the rest to improve her daily farming activities. She will use the profits from the milk trade to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: To buy tea leaves for sale and improve her daily farming activities

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 29 years old, married to Joseph, and together they are blessed with five children.

She has a boutique business in Naivasha which she has been running for seven years, and she has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase a stock of clothes for sale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy more stock for her business and pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest boutique in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zhidmad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhidmad está  formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por la parroquia Zhidmad en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de mucha vegetación, de verdes campos y hermosos paisajes, lugar que permite disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad del campo. Todos sus habitantes al igual que las socias son personas que luchan muy duro para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y así brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, trabajan en la agricultura y crianza de animales y muchos laboran a diario en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas
Una de las socias de este grupo es Señora. Purificación, es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Zhidmad, le gusta pertenecer a este grupo de cerdito por la unión y solidaridad que existe entre todas sus compañeras.
La Señora Purificación tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos mayores de edad  que están casados y viven independientes, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Ella se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos, caballos y ganado del cual obtiene la leche, con la leche realiza quesos y los vende en la ciudad.  También labora en la agricultura que es para su consumo y para la venta. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en abono y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es  crecer en la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Communal Bank “Zhidmad” is composed of ten women that live close to Zhidmad, a village in Cuenca. This area is surrounded by vegetation, green fields and beautiful landscapes, and it is a place where it is possible to enjoy the peaceful and quiet countryside. 

The group’s members and the rest of the inhabitants work hard to keep the stability at home and give their children a better future. They all work in agriculture and raise animals. Many of them work every day in the city, performing different economic activities.

One of the members is Purificación. She is one of the founding members of this group. She likes to be part of this group because the members have a close relationship and help each other. Purificación is 64 years old, married, and has four children who are adults now, married and live independently. Her husband works in agriculture and they live together in a house they own. She raises guinea pigs, pigs, horses and dairy cattle. With the milk, she makes cheese to sell in the city. She also works in agriculture, growing vegetables for her own consumption and to sell.

Purificación is requesting a loan to buy compost and animal feed. Her goal is to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy compost and animal feed.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien would like to take a further loan to buy plastic materials to increase her production of laminated items. Tien's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials to use for laminating.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 64 years old and married with six children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Antonieta has borrowed and repaid twenty-three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and she earns additional income from raising ducks.

Antonieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, tailoring chalk, etc for her tailoring business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, tailoring chalk, etc

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Gyumri town with her two children, 9 and 1 year old. The only source of family income comes from cosmetology services that she has been providing for the last five years. Due to her tireless work, Marine manages to provide her small family with normal living conditions. She receives her clients at home and provides different types of cosmetology services. 

Now, in order to be able to enlarge the service that she provides, Marine needs financial support. She has applied for this loan and currently has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.
