She belongs to the communal bank "Los Girasoles" [The Sunflowers] and at this moment requires a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to make her monthly payments with much diligence.

(The city of Patria is located in the district of Kosnipata in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana María tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de todo tipo. A dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen el negocio de fotocopiados, tipeos, impresiones, búsquedas de trabajos en internet, también se dedican a brindar servicios de consultoría a la municipalidad de su zona, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar una moto de segunda y de esta manera movilizarse más oportunamente para brindar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 54 years old, and lives together with her husband in the district of Oyotun. Oyotun's population is engaged in agriculture and commerce of all types. The district is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She and her husband have a business that offers photocopying, typing, printing, and Internet-based employment search services. They also offer consulting services to the local municipality. She has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy a secondhand motorcycle and thus be able to transport herself more promptly to provide her services.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so she will have the mobility to offer consulting services

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen was born and lives in Vanadzor town. He is not married and lives with his mother, sister and grandfather. Arsen's father is now a labor migrant in a neighboring country and works hard to help his family with their daily costs. 

Currently the family's main source of income is a retail business that Arsen has been involved in for a year; he owns a small truck in which he transports different goods (home supplies, food, etc.) to sell to neighboring villages. Realizing the importance of the income that he gets from this business, Arsen wants to enlarge it.  He is asking for this loan to use to purchase more products for reselling.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This loan is very important for this hard working young man who, despite of his young age, perfectly manages to provide his family with normal living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for products to resell to customers

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 57-year-old housewife from Kutaisi Town, West Georgia. She lives with her husband, student daughter-in-law and infant grandchild. Marine's son lives and works abroad to help his family financially. Marine's husband,Teimuraz, works as a cook at a restaurant in a neighboring town earning a small monthly salary. 

As the family's existing funds are modest and hardly enough to cover expenses, Marine and Teimuraz decided to start their own family business. With the received credit, they plan to hire a commercial space and purchase needed inventory for starting a food cafe. Teimuraz will leave his job and work in their cafe as a cook; he makes delicious dishes and is very skilled.

Marine and Teimuraz hope that their project will be profitable as the cafe location is great and crowded with people. The couple believes that they will earn a good income for their family's well being and their son will be able to return home.

They await your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a cafe in her town

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a hard-working Iraqi client. He is 45 years old, married and has 3 children, for whom he works hard to provide.

Haydar owns a shop where he prepares plates of scriptures taken from the Holy Quran. He is very famous in the neighborhood since he is the only person with such a career. He established his business in 2011 and now he has 3 hired employees already. Haydar has an excellent reputation and is respected by his entire neighborhood.

Haydar is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy an additional machine which is specialized for melting metals. Haydar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide better life standards for his family.

loans.use: to buy an additional machine which is specializes in melting metals

loans.name: Lizbeth Grimaneza

texts.es:
Lizbeth tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de granos ,a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Desde que se caso Ella nos explica que se dedica a la venta de soya y de esta manera puede contribuir con su esposo con los gastos para mantener su familia, son una familia emprendedora Lizbeth ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar frutas y envases para preparar mermeladas y poder ofrecer a sus clientes, de esta manera generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 29 years old and lives together with her family in Morropon, where the population mostly engages in agriculture and commercialization of grains. Morropon is located two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

Since getting married, Lizbeth has been working in the sale of soy and in this way she helps her husband with the household expenses. They are an enterprising family. Lizbeth has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy fruit and containers to prepare jams to offer to her customers, and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers and fruit to prepare jams for her business

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Zaña, una zona donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella nos explica que desde que se caso se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales menores para apoyar a su esposo con el sustento de su familia, Rosi como a si lo conocen en su comunidad ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar patos, cuyes y pavos para posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 58 years old.  She lives together with her husband in the Zaña district, an area where the people work in agriculture and trade, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

She explains that since the time when she got married, she has worked raising and selling small farm animals to help out her husband with the family expenses.  Rosi is known for this in her community.  She has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy ducks, guinea pigs, and turkeys, to later offer them at a good price to her customers.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals, ducks, guinea pigs, and turkeys for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his blacksmith's shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi is 53-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs capital to continue his work. Shahzadi is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings for the children's future education. Shahzadi hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: A loan of $300 helps Shahzadi's husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is 42-years-old and a hard working and independent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons and two daughters. All the children are studying. Her husband is a security guard and his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. For one year, Farida has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, Farida has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Once she earns a profit, she will first repay the loan amount to Kiva and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too much congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of some cosmetic products for a salon.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina de 44 años, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales están estudiando diferentes grados; uno de ellos está cursando el bachillerato, y los demás en un nivel más bajo, su esposo se ha dedicado por años a la agricultura, que es de donde ha tenido ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. También, se dedica a trabajos de albañil donde tiene sus ingresos, y sus hijos al salir de la escuela se dedican ayudar en las actividades del hogar. La familia se conforma de 5 personas 3 hijos y ellos.

Por su parte, Rosalina, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, como maíz, frijol y otros. Esta lo hace desde hace mucho tiempo, aproximadamente 12 años,  y con todo ese tiempo, ha aprendido a adquirir experiencia, la cual hoy en día conoce muy bien todas las actividades que requiere un cultivo. Todo esto lo aprendió, gracias a la ayuda de sus padres y el apoyo que le ha dado a su esposo en cada época, que se necesita la siembra de granos. Para llegar al lugar donde realiza su trabajo, debe de caminar media hora para llegar al terreno, donde cultiva en muchas ocasiones también sus hijos le ayudan en el trabajo de la agricultura.

El dinero de este préstamo, será invertido, para pagar la mano de obra que requiere para recolectar, los granos básicos, de esta cosecha el cual tiene 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol, el cual por el tiempo climático está preocupada, porque de no sacar rápido podría causar pérdidas económicas a la familia. También solventara una deuda, porque hace 2 días antes de solicitar este crédito falleció el papá de su compañero de vida. 

En el futuro, piensa en poder ver a sus hijos salir adelante, también quiere tener legalizado el terreno de la casa donde vive y poder vivir sin problemas y que su familia tenga las condiciones adecuadas para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 44 years old, is the mother of 3 children who are all in school in different grades.  One of her children is in high school and the other two are at a lower level.  Her husband has worked in agriculture for many years, which has allowed them to earn the income to support their children.  He also works in masonry which supplements their income.  After school, their children help with household chores.

The family is made up of 5 people, 3 children and them, the parents.  On her end, Rosalina plants basic grains such as corn, beans and others.  She has been doing this for a long time, about 12 years, and in all of that time, she has been able to learn and gain experience, and now she knows all of the activities required for planting well.  She has been able to learn all of this thanks to her parents, and the help she has given her husband every planting season.  In order to get to the place where she works, she must walk half an hour.  In many occasions, her children also help her with the agricultural work.

The money from this loan will be used to pay the labor necessary to pick the basic grains from this harvest in which she has 10,500 square meters of corn and beans.  Due to the change in season, she is worried because if she does not harvest the crops quickly, their family may suffer financial losses.  The loan will also help settle a debt, because 2 days before seeking this loan, her husbands father passes away.  

In the future, she hopes to see her children get ahead.  She also wants to own the land that her house is on and be able to live without any problems, and for her family to have adequate conditions for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the labor needed to harvest her crops, of which she has 10,500 square meters of corn and beans.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María una mujer trabajadora de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad tiene tres hijas de 21, 19 y 15 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposo, viven en casa de sus padres ya que el esposo se quedo en su casa, la misma que está ubicada en una zona urbana de la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia Eloy Alfaro, provincia Cotopaxi perteneciente a la República del Ecuador este es un sector muy comercial de la ciudad por su buena ubicación geográfica.
Debido a la mala situación económica que atravesó ella y sus hijas después de la separación de su esposo tuvo que trabajar y dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pollos, las ganancias las ha designado para la manutención de su hija Verónica que es la menor de las tres debido a que sus dos hijas mayores ya están casadas y tienen su hogar formado
Se dedica a la crianza de los pollos de 4 a 5 horas diarias, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, pero le resulta muy difícil ya que no cuenta con una persona que le ayude; ya que por su trabajo de medio tiempo no le alcanza para poder atender su negocio, las ventas las realiza en forma ambulante y bajo pedido, solicita este crédito para la compra de más pollos y balanceado debido a que se acerca la época de navidad y en estas fechas la demanda es mayor a la de otros meses y esas ventas ayudarán a incrementar las ganancias de María.  
María quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal, para brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 44, is a hardworking woman.  Currently she's separated from her husband.  She has three daughters, ages 21, 19, and 15.  They live in her parents' house because her husband stayed in her house, which is located in an urban area in the city of Latacunga, in Eloy Alfaro Parish in the province of Cotopaxi, Republic of Ecuador.  This is a very commercial area of the city because of its good geographic location.

María had to work raising and selling chickens because of the bad economic situation she and her daughters went through after she separated from her husband.  She has used her earnings to support her daughter Verónica, the youngest of the three, because her two older daughters are already married and have their own families.

She works four or five hours a day raising chickens.  She learned this work from her mother, but it's hard for her because she doesn't have anyone to help her.  Because of her part-time job she doesn't have enough time to take care of her business.  She makes sales on foot and takes orders.

María's requesting this loan to buy more chickens and balanced feed because Christmas is approaching and demand is greater than in other months.  These sales will help María increase her profits.

María extends her sincere thanks and greetings to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in her working and personal life so she can give her daughter a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and balanced feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his car with a better eco-friendly electric and gas-consuming hybrid car for his taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit tree seedlings and also pay rental fee for booth in local market to sell their products and seeds for fruit and vegetables by herself

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sells second hand clothes in Tala town and has been in the business for 6 years now. She is 59 years old, widowed, and has 2 children. She takes care of 3 grandchildren as well.

She will be using this loan to buy more clothes to sell. This will enable her to make more profits which she will use to educate her grand children and to repay her loan.

This is her 2nd loan term and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Susan's hopes for the future is to see her grandchildren well catered for and educated.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a car for his business to use to reduce transportation expenses and increase his income

loans.name: Alpha S

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Alpha.  He is married, and has one child who is 15 months old. He has no additional dependents. 

In 2003, Alpha established his commercial rice, flour and soft drinks business. He began his business because he saw it as his own source of survival.  Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

Alpha would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Alpha requires a loan in order to buy more goods for his shop. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his profit margin. In the future, Alpha plans to complete his house from the proceeds of the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en: Thamer is a married client from Iraq. He is 36 years old and has a single child. Thamer works to provide his family income and pay the tuition fees of his child. Thamer is a baker. He owns a small bakery and specializes in making pastries and bread. He established his business in 2000 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has two employees and has a good reputation in his surrounding area thanks to the special flavor of his dough. Thamer is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy pay the annual rent for his bakery. He hopes to grow his business and increase his profits so that he is able to take care of his family and continue to provide the tuition fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy pay the annual rent for his bakery

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is married and has four children, all of whom are adults. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water.

Sera has operated a coconut selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for resale

loans.name: Jose Fidencio

texts.es:
Jose Fidencio tiene 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en unan zona rural de Querocotillo, su población se dedica al cultivo de café y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad e Cutervo, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.
Hace 5 años se dedica al servicio de arado con yunta, Jose Fidencio nos explica weu es una actividad que se realiza para prepara el terreno para los cultivos, también se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno.
El ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una yunta joven y de esta manera seguir brindado el servicio a sus clientes y así seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Fidencio is 50 years old. He and his wife live in Querocotillo, a rural zone located two hours from the city of Cutervo whose residents grow coffee and raise livestock. It is located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú.

For the past 5 years, he has made a living by providing plowing services. Jose Fidencio explains that this is an activity that is done to prepare the land for crops. He also raises and sells cattle.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase a young plowing team so that he can continue to provide service to his customers and continue to generate income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing team to provide plowing services.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widowed woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She sells cooked food from home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase foodstuffs such as maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
Hipólito es un microempresario, cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Hipólito tiene 35 años, está casado y tiene tres hijos; dos de los cuales estudian la primaria. Su esposa se llama Olga y tiene 13 años de casado; él considera a su familia muy unida. 

En su negocio, que está ubicado en el centro de la colonia donde vive, vende cremería, abarrotes y refrescos. La tienda la atienden entre su papá, con quien aparece en la foto, y él y tienen una gran cantidad de clientes. 

El crédito lo utilizará para mejorar su negocio y tener más mayores ingresos adecuando su camioneta para poder transportar mercancía.  Gracias a su negocio Hipólito ha logrado crear un patrimonio para él y su familia, así como hacer crecer su negocio. Su principal reto es mantenerse como comerciante, ya que existe mucha competencia en la zona.
texts.en:
Hipólito is a small business owner, client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Hipólito is 35, married and has three children; two of whom study in primary school. His wife is named Olga and they have been married for 13 years. He considers his family to be very united.

In his business, which is located in the center of the neighborhood where he lives, he sells dairy products, groceries and soda. He and his father, with whom he appears in the photo, look after the store. They have a large amount of customers.

He will use the loan to improve his business and have more income by adapting his truck to be able to transport merchandise. Thanks to his business Hipólito has achieved creating an inheritance for him and his family, as well as making his business grow. His main challenge is maintaining himself as a merchant, given that there is much competition in the area.

loans.use: to adjust his truck so he can transport merchandise

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is from Kutaisi town, West Georgia. She is 31 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two toddler children. Eka is jobless at the moment and stays home. The only one who makes money in the household is Eka’s husband who is a car mechanic--he earns monthly salary.

Her husband's earnings are modest and he doesn’t manage to save money. With the received loan, Eka will start a confectionery shop. She is good at baking and wishes to sell her production to the local people. Eka will purchase construction materials and renovate a small store that is located near her house. She will also purchase an oven and raw materials to bake various kinds of cakes. Eka hopes her business will generate income since there is no other similar store nearby. She hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a confectionery shop.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is a 54-year-old married man. He lives in a small village in the Terjola district with his wife, brother and two sons. His son is disabled and gets a pension from the government of 100 GEL per month. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows and pigs. They produce cheese and sell it locally. In addition, Davit owns a small vineyard and produces wine to sell. As the income is seasonal and is not enough for the family, Davit decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 USD for purchasing a minibus. Once the minibus is purchased, he will work on the minibus line and earn income. With the increased income, Davit will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny esta soltero, no tiene  hijos;  ocupa 2 habitaciones en un departamento alquilado el cual esta ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente  percibe un sueldo con el cual se mantiene y ayuda  a su familia y puede solventar sus gastos minimos de estudios ropa y alimentación

El crédito que requiere es para comprar una Laptop, y algunos libros para la elaboracion de su tesis ya que se va a graduar  como abogado.

El sueño de Jhony es poder culminar la carrera con éxito y poder aumentar su sueldo en el lugar donde trabaja y posteriormente tener su propia casa.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Johnny is single and does not have children. He lives in a two-room rental apartment located in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. 

He currently receives a salary and assistance from his family, with which he is able to afford his minimal expenses, like school, clothing, and food. He will use the loan that he is requesting to purchase a laptop and some books to finish his thesis, since he is going to graduate from law school.

Johnny's goal is to be able to finish his degree successfully, receive a pay raise at his job, and own his own home.

This is Johnny's fourth loan with IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and books to finish his final thesis in law school.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business, and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chickens, and beans.

She works at the market seven days out of every week, and sells in retail. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken, and beans.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, patos, gallinas, cuyes, también tiene un pequeño kiosco donde ofrece venta de comida preparada y golosinas, Ana María ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de animales pequeños y posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes y asi tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María is 44 years old. She lives with her two children in the Nueva Arica district, whose residents work in agriculture and small animal sales. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Perú's northern coast.

She makes a living by raising and selling barnyard animals, like ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also has a small kiosk where she sells prepared food and snacks.

Ana María has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of small animals, which she will later offer to her customers at a better price. This will allow her to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals for fattening.

loans.name: En

texts.en: En is 58 years of age and married with five children, three of whom are married and live separately. To earn a living, En and her husband are employed as paid laborers working for other villagers’ plantation around Baray district, Kampong Thom province. However, the income is not enough to cover their daily costs of living. To solve this situation, En’s son decided to work as a laborer in Thailand, where he expects to generate a better wage in the local region. Because of the lack of funds for passport preparation, En would like to borrow a loan of KHR 1,000,000, which will be used to pay for a passport. She is hoping that the loan will be granted to enable them to improve their general living conditions. She thanks lenders for their generosities towards poor fellows like her.

loans.use: to pay for a passport for her son to work abroad

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.ru: Нуржан 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Нуржан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нуржан занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуржан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 50 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,25 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). Нуржан входит в группу "Хан-Бурго", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Нуржан является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Nurjan is 49, married, and has four children. She has a high school education and raises livestock to support her family. She started farming 19 years ago when she bought cattle for 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work she now earns 19,000 som (KGS) per month, and her farm includes one milk cow, one horse, 50 sheep, and 1.25 hectares of land for planting potatoes and clover. She is a member of the group "Khan-Burgo," which has two other members. In order to continue building up her farm, Nurjan asked the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for breeding. With her income from the loan Nurjan plans to continue to invest in more livestock and to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg, 31 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling beauty products to local people at a trade center since 2012. Her husband works at a private firm. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. 

Battsetseg is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After renovation, she and her husband will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a taxi driver who has been in the business for nine years. Elchin is 35 years old. He is married and has a two year old and eleven year old son. His elder son goes to four classes. They are IDP (internally displaced persons) from the İsiqli village of Füzuli city and now live in Absheron region in hostel where life is so hard.

Elchin is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 AZN for repairs to his taxi car. This year his car was damaged and therefore, he cannot work. Elchin does not work and cannot support his family. To restore monthly income, his car needs to be repaired. He hopes that if his car is repaired, his situation will be good enough to be able to support his family as he did before.

This is his second loan from Kiva. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their help. In the future, he wants to have his own house.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is 40 years old. She is single and now lives in the Absheron region with her parents. For already 20 years, they have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Xidirli village of Agdam. Nazila has been in the tailoring business for seven years. She sews skirts, blouses, other woman's dresses, and also sews curtains. She receives orders from her periodic customers, and prepares the orders.

Today she plans to increase her working capital to buy a new fabric. For this reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN.
She is thankful to Kiva and Komak organizations for a loan. In the future she wants to open a curtain store.

loans.use: to buy a new fabric.

loans.name: Ramziya

texts.en:
Remziya is 21 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and brother. Her family has been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city for 20 years, and now live in the Ahmadbayli village in the Füzuli region. Her mother is a housewife and she also helps Remziya in her business. Her father, Mahmud, is a taxi driver. Ramziye’s brother, Mahammad, is a seller in the market.
 
Remziya has cows. She sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese and so on) which is made by Ramziya and her mother. Now Remziya wants to buy more cows to increase her business. Therefore she needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

She thankful for this loan from Komak and the Kiva organization. She wants to build a big stall for cows and to buy a few sheep.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Mushfig

texts.en:
Mushfig is a taxi driver. He is 44 years old. He is married and has a child. His child goes to second course at the university. Mushfig’s wife, Gulmaye, is a barber.

Mushfig has applied for a loan in the amount of 500 AZN to repair his car. He has been at that business for 10 years and his car is outdated. His car was damaged and therefore, he can’t work. He hasn't worked for a while and cannot support his family. 

To restore his monthly income, he needs to repair the car. He believes that if his car will be repaired, his situation will be good enough, as before, and he will be able to support his family.

He thankful to Komak and Kiva for help. In the future he wants to repair his house.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.es: Sinforosa vive en la ciudad de Patria junto con su familia y es considerada como una persona   trabajadora y responsable, ella se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde cosecha achote, naranjas, piñas, cocona, plátanos, yuca, hojas  de coca y frutos tropicales. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Girasoles” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La ciudad de Patria está ubicado en el distrito de Kosñipata de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Sinforosa lives in the city of Patria with her family. She is considered a hard working and responsible person. She works in agriculture as she has various fields of crop where she harvests annattos, oranges, pineapples, coconas, bananas, yucca, cocoa leaves and tropical fruits. She has been doing this work for many years and it’s going well because of the effort she puts into her work. She belongs to the communal bank “Los Girasoles” (The Sunflowers).
 
At this time she needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She is grateful and appreciative for the loan and is committed to making her repayments within the agreed period. (The city of Patria is located in the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Rafiqa is 23-year-old young client. She is an IDP person (internally displaced person). She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her parents. Rafiqa couldn’t get higher education  and because of that she decided to start her own business. For that she chose farming.

She  is growing fruits and vegetables in her  own yard. Her  brother helps her,  too.  Rafiqa wants to expand her business. The amount of products she sells is not enough to cover the high demand. She would like to grow  more fruits and vegetables to increase her turnover as well as improve the living conditions of her  partners. For this purpose, she has applied for a 2000 AZN loan. This will be her second loan, and Rafiqa  has a good client history.

loans.use: to grow  more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a lady of twenty eight years, married, and a mother of three children. She runs a tailoring business in Nairobi. Eunice has been in this business for sixteen years now, and gets a monthly income of  25,000 KES.

This will be Eunice's third loan with Kadet Ltd., and she plans to use the whole amount to buy clothing materials for making new clothes. In the future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard is an experienced agronomist from Hovtashat village of Ararat region. She lives with her two sons, and daughter-in-law. Her husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant in order to work there and send some money to the family to take care of their needs. Silvard is engaged in breeding a livestock of pigs and hens, and in the cultivation of alfalfa. She also cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, and peppers in a greenhouse. 

Her sons help her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming. They realize the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of family's income. To develop her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Silvard needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase polyethylene for the greenhouse, renovate the greenhouse, and to buy tomato seeds and some fertilizers. Silvard and her family members rely highly on the goodwill of the lenders, and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene for the greenhouse, renovate the greenhouse, and buy tomato seeds and some fertilizers.

loans.name: Matilde Florentina

texts.es:
Matilde Florentina tiene 52 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Lagunas, donde su población se dedica al comercio y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Hace dos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles con la finalidad de comprar patos, cuyes, gallinas y chivos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a mayor precio a sus clientes generándoles mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde Florentina is 52 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Lagunas, where the people work in commerce and agriculture, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north shore of Peru.Two years ago she began raising and selling small animals. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to purchase ducks, guinea pigs, chickens and goats to fatten them and to sell them at a higher price to her customers to generate larger revenue for her family.

loans.use: to purchase small animals: ducks, guinea pigs and chickens for her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en Morropon una comunidad conocida por sus bosques de algarrobos, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura , costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en su mototaxi trasladando a sus clientes desde su comunidad a caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando este serbio.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 33 years old and lives with his wife in Morropon, a community know for its carob forests, two hours from the city of Piura on the north shore of Peru. He offers transportation on his motorcycle taxi taking customers from his community to neighbouring small towns. 

He is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to maintain his vehicle so that he can continue providing this service.

loans.use: maintain his vehicle that provides transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock for her slipper business.

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

Phenny has operated a cereal shop business at the market for the past three months, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils

loans.name: Velime

texts.en:
Velime is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of four children between the ages of 25 to 18 years old. Velime is a very hardworking woman who does a lot to keep her family healthy and stable, trying all possible ways to survive and provide income. 

Based on family tradition, she works in agriculture while her husband earns a pension. Until recently, she owned a cow, and currently cultivates her land in order to reduce costs for food products for her family as well as provide additional income; however, she had to sell the cow to provide additional money for her family. 

Now, she is requesting a loan so that she can once again purchase a cow to be able to continue to use the dairy products for her family and for income. She hopes in this way to be able to provide additional savings for her children and provide for their basic needs. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Tsisana

texts.en:
Tsisana is from the village of Kindzati. She is 58 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and infant granddaughter. 
The family runs a small-scale agricultural business, and cultivates a plot of land where maize and red-beans are grown. Tsisana breeds two pigs as well, and plans to sell them in the wintertime when prices are higher. Tsisana’s husband owns a truck and transports firewood from forest. He cuts and sells them among the locals to earn seasonal income.
 
The family funds are modest, and Tsisana is not able to cover feeding and daily costs. That is the reason why she has decided to apply for the credit and start a dairy farm. With this Start up loan, Tsisana will purchase a milk cow to produce cheese for selling as well as family consumption. Tsisana will sell the cheese from her house among community members and earn additional income. This credit will be a great support for her family, and Tsiala hopes your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow to produce cheese for selling as well as family consumption.

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar is married and lives with her husband and three school-aged sons who are 13, 14 and 16 years old. She is an experienced agronomist from Gogaran village in the Lori region. Tsovinar and her husband have more than 15 years of experience and intensive engagement in agriculture. They breed cattle, practice aviculture, raise sheep and pigs, and cultivate wheat and grass.The agribusiness is the only source of family's income. As the autumn is progressing, Tsovinar needs to make some investments to prepare for winter. 

Tsovinar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan to purchase some forage for her livestock and make credit repayments. Tsovinar and her family highly rely on the good will of lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some forage for her livestock and make credit repayments

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is a 55-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has four children. Her husband is a mechanic. Lan earns a living running a general store, which she has done for three years. Lan would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as shampoos, dishwashing liquid, snack foods, and confectionary to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more basic goods such as shampoo, dishwashing liquid and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making sweet bread such as sugar, flour, salt, eggs, food coloring, and some equipment that she needs, as she will be starting up a business selling bread.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang is a 57-year-old divorced woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 4 children. Vang earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 10 years. Vang would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as many kind of household items, soft drinks, and confectioneries to stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers, and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, help her improve her family's living conditions, and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy household items, soft drinks, and confectioneries to stock her general store.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina lives in Gyumri town with her parents. 

For three years, Evelina has been providing manicure services to local customers. From a rented stall, Evelina provides different types of manicure services and earns her living. 

Now, she needs financial support to purchase tools and materials to continue providing her service. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Evelina, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Evelina has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To pay for tools and materials to provide manicure services

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en:
Shirin is a first-year student of AUCA, department of Liberal Arts and Sciences, and here is her story:

“Each of us, after ending school, should choose the university and the faculty where he or she wants to study. People are convinced that a person who goes to his work with pleasure and comes back home gladly every day, is the happiest one. Most of us are supposed to think about our future careers since childhood. But when we become older, we always change our viewpoints and preferences. Not all images, which we dreamed about, satisfy us. We become more realistic, and start envisaging a profession we want to choose. This is the choice of our path to the real life.

The world of departments of universities is prodigious. It consists of huge number of professions. Each of us is responsible for solving a great issue, for the new step in our life. in this moment of our lives, we doubt, take suggestions, hesitate, and listen to parents and friends opinion. This particular line of professions require people be able to make decisions quickly and manage people. Unfortunately, not always that we can define our abilities and make the right decisions at our young ages. I think no one, neither young nor old, can say quickly whatever decision they are up to.
 
I thought many times and made a decision to enter the Liberal Arts department. What I like in this department is that it teaches leadership skills to us, historic thinking, religion, etc. Another reason to choose this department is that I would like to know little about juridical knowledge too. As a student of the department, it is necessary for me to graduate the university as a highly qualified person who is capable to think critically, and work in group by using my knowledge that I will already have.
 
Another opportunity that AUCA gives to every student is a Kiva loan. It is what can make dreams come true. I am applying for the loan as well, as I have financial difficulties and am not able to cover my tuition fees fully.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Senitima

texts.en:
Senitima is a 22-year-old woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro and cocoa samoa beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Senitima has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed-sprayer, a wheelbarrow, a spade and a crowbar for her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Senitima hopes to assist with her family's daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy weedsprayer, a wheelbarrow, a spade and a crow bar

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a kind woman. She was born in 1985. She is a married parent of three children. During some years, she has not any job because she has been busy with the upbringing of her children. Nowadays, her children have become older and require more money. That’s why Hamida wants to organize her own business. 

Hamida is going to organize a business with animal husbandry. She plans to buy cows, fatten them for some months and sell them in the local market. Her husband will help her with fattening the cattle. 

She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women’s organization, and she got a certificate. Hamida is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy cattle. She awaits your support. She has higher pedagogical education, and she is smart.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a single mother of two children; one of her children goes to school. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and cabbages.  

She works at the market six days out of every week, and sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and perishability.  

She is aspiring to grow some of those vegetables, and also to build her own house.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, eggplants, and cabbages.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en:
Wallace is a very hard working man from Olkalou. He is married to Monicah, who is a housewife, and they are blessed with one child, six months old.

Wallace owns a mobile phone accessories shop, a business he has been running for the last four years. He has applied for his third loan of 52,000 KES from Kadet Ltd. He will use the loan to purchase more stock, such as phone batteries, phone chargers and electronics like hand watches and power cables.

He believes that he is going to realize greater monthly income from his expanded business, which is currently 25,000 KES. He intends to use his income to pay back his loan to Kadet Ltd. and to improve the living standards of his family.

Wallace hopes to be the owner of the largest electronics store in his area in the future.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phone accessories and electronics to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a very hard working lady from Olkalou. She is 44 years old and married to Peter. They are blessed with two children, aged 17 and 15.

Beatrice is in the quarry mining industry, a business she has been running for the last ten years. Beatrice has applied for her second loan of 40,000 KES from Kadet, Ltd. She plans to use the loan to hire more quarry miners for more production and hence earn more income.

Her monthly income right now is 20,000 KES. She intends to use profits from her expanded business to purchase livestock and to educate her children.

Beatrice has dreams and hopes of becoming the leading quarry operator in her region.

loans.use: To hire more miners in her quarry

loans.name: Minas

texts.en:
Minas is married and lives with his wife and one-year-old son. He is a farmer from Gogaran village in the Lori region. To take care of his family's needs, Minas is a beekeeper and he also cultivates wheat, barley, and grass. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Minas needs to make some investments. 

Minas is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to purchase some fertilizer and fuel for his agricultural machinery. His loan will be a huge support to this hardworking man and his family and will help them maintain their agribusiness.  Minas and his family highly rely on the good will of lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel for his agricultural machinery

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Айсулуу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулуу занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 13 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Айсулуу входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 3 человека. Айсулуу является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 39 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband. Aisuluu has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry, a business Aisuluu started 19 years ago with the purchase of 5,000 KGS worth of cattle. Thanks to Aisuluu's hard work, her farm currently boasts three dairy cows, one horse, and  thirteen goats. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KGS. Aisuluu is a member of the group "Almaluu." This group includes three other people. Aisuluu is the second member. In order to further develop her farm, Aisuluu has asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy calves for cattle breeding. Aisuluu plans to invest income from loan into further increasing the number of domestic animals she has, and she plans to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, a 53-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City; she has one son. She supports her family by running a business sewing clothing. 

Ha requests a loan to purchase one more sewing machine to satisfy her customers. 

This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly, and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is an experienced agronomist from Gogaran village of Lori region. She lives with her husband and son. Alla's husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant; he works there and sends money to the family to take care of their needs. 

With the help of her son, Alla is extensively engaged in breeding cattle, aviculture, breeding a livestock of sheep and pigs, and cultivating wheat, potatoes, and grass. Alla and her son realize the agricultural products at the local market, which is the most important source of their income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Alla needs a loan of USD 2,500 to pay for the harvesting services, purchase some forage for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments. She and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be very thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting services, purchase some forage for the livestock, and make previous credit repayments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two steers, to buy forage (barley) for the livestock, and to renovate the barn, which is in poor condition

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha, 27, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Ha and her husband earn money through their business producing wood products. Ha would like to get a loan to buy a machine and tools for processing and making many kind of products of wood to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy a machine and tools for processing and making many kind of products of wood

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet, a 54-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two daughters. Her husband earns a living selling glutinous rice cakes. Tuyet supports her family by running a clothing business. 

Tuyet requests a loan to purchase cloth and sewing materials to satisfy her customers. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and that she will earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing materials to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc, 56, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Phuoc's husband earns money working as a local unit guard. Phuoc supports her family by running a soft drinks shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks to stock her shop. She hopes her business will run smoothly, and her family will have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity and variety of soft drinks to stock her shop.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en:
Sau, 38, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her son and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mason.

Sau has been in her business for eight years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoos and dyes. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials, such as shampoos and dyes.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en: Vinh, 57, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, which includes two sons, one daughter and her husband. Vinh and her husband earn money through their business producing wood products. Vinh would like to get a loan to buy tools and wood for processing and making many kinds of wood products to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy tools and wood to make wood products

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is from Dzghdzut village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Lida has been extensively engaged in agribusiness for more than 15 years. With the help of her family members, she breeds hens and turkeys and cultivates peaches, apricots, cherries, plums, strawberries, apples, and walnuts. She realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. As autumn is progressing, Lida's agribusiness needs some investments. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a great help to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling them to purchase some fertilizers and new layers for tree planting. Lida and her family rely heavily on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their help in gathering the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and new layers for tree planting

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is a 45-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh city. She has two children. Van earns an income to support her children by running a business that serves people who are renting a car. Her husband is a driver for hire. Van has been in her business for nine years. She plans to use this loan to open a new business selling clothes and she will use her loan to buy clothing to sell. Van hopes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and better support her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Жылдызкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). Жылдызкан входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 3 человека. В итоге их четверо. Жылдызкан является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan is 33 years old, married, and raising five children with her husband. Jyldyzkan has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry, a business Jyldyzkan started eight years ago by purchasing 25,000 KGS worth of livestock. Thanks to Jyldyzkan's hard work, the farm currently boasts one dairy cow and five goats. Her monthly income is 6,000 KGS. Jyldyzkan is a member of the group "Almaluu". This group includes three other people. So there are four of them. Jyldyzkan is the leader of the group. In order to further develop her farm, Jyldyzkan asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy lambs for breeding. Jyldyzkan plans to invest income from the loan into increasing her livestock and plans to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy lambs

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong is a 26-year-old woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an employee. She has been running a business selling clothes for one year. Duong would like to take loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 63-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a small village in the Gurjaani district. Nana and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. They have a vineyard and produce wine to sell locally. Nana decided to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1500 GEL to start a trading business. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of groceries in Tbilisi and will transport them by her husband's car to her district to sell. Her husband will help her and she hopes that the business will be profitable. The Start Up program will be a great support for this pensioner couple.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka is from Kutaisi town where she lives with her 14-year-old nephew. She is 31 years old, single and earns a living through linen sales. Specifically, she gets her stock of merchandise from the local retailers and sells for a profit among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores, Maka's business is in high demand. She is very nice to her customers and does her job with love and care. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing and household items at wholesale prices in Turkey, where prices are lower than in Georgia, and continue her business. Maka will be able to get more profit and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: to purchase clothing and household items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric for wedding decorations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables, flour, and other inventories.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling tomatoes and onions. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes and onions. She doesn't have any other income-generating activities. 

She works at the market seven days out of every week, and sells in both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include rainy season and transportation. She is aspiring to engage in green bananas, buy a land, and start farming. 

She decided to join MCDT SACCO to expand her business. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has a boutique and has been in this business for seven years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.

Janet has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more clothes and shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to open another boutique in the neighborhood and also to own a fully stocked boutique. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. 

Janet resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her business, which sells a variety of vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stocks of vegetables and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and expand by adding sliver fish to her business. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do a little bit of expansion to her shop and buy some items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his household.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 20 years old. He is employed in the motorcycle transport business and supports his seven siblings.

Mathias has been in this business for the last two years, with a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He has been advanced his first loan of KES 87,880, which he will use to purchase his own motorcycle. He is likely to earn more with the flexibility that comes with asset ownership and the already established large customer base.

He will use the proceeds to assist the family to meet their basic needs. He hopes to improve his family's living standards. His dream is to see his family prosper, even as he himself prospers.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her 5-year-old son. Hermine's husband currently is a labor migrant who continues to look for job with good terms. 

For tackling financial hardships, Hermine got involved in a retail clothing business a year ago. She works hard to cover daily living expenses and providing appropriate living conditions for her son. Realizing that the retail clothing business is quite profitable, and she can earn a higher income through it, Hermine would like to expand it. 

Because she has no savings, Hermine asks for this loan for financial support. The loan will help her purchase a new stock of clothing that she will sell to her customers.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
 
Hermine waits for lenders' support, and hopes for their help.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 47, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband runs a business of selling shoes; Nga supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business two years ago, and she sells fish sauces, snack foods, shampoos, and other household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and set aside some money for facing difficulties in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and household items, to stock her store

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 61-year-old widowed woman. She has 9 children. Tuyet lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For seven years she has operated a food stall to sell meals to people in their community.

Tuyet would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality food and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture, good quality food and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Kosi

texts.en:
Kosi is 30 years old and earns a living running her own business selling smoked fish. She has run the business for two years. She gets help from a sister to serve the customers better. In this way, Kosi is able to generate enough income to contribute towards her household expenses.

Currently she is asking for the loan to buy two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers. It will also allow her to have enough stock to meet the demand for products and face the various challenges caused by unexpected rises in fish prices. This affects her finances and her customers since the prices are very variable and unstable. By doing this, she will be able to increase sales and the income she makes. 

Kosi says she wants to continue working hard to move her business forward and fulfill her dream of building her own store, generating better profits and income, so she can improve for her parents' well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a guard man. Hien supports her family by selling meals in the local community. She would like a loan to buy a larger quantity of better quality food, which will enable her to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of better quality food to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is a 48-year-old mother of seven children living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a medical clinic where he provides first aid services to patients. He has been taking training from a professional MBBS doctor and now owns the small medical clinic on the basis of his experience. He has been treating his patients and his patients are recovering well. He has become very famous in the society and wants to establish his clinic through highly effective medicines but he does not have capital. Therefore, Razia requested a loan for her husband; she hopes that her husband will be able to buy medicine so that he can earn maximum profits. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. Note: Razia raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy medicine for a medical clinic.

loans.name: Thoc

texts.en:
Thoc, 58, is married and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her son and three daughters. Thoc has run a food stall at her door for four years. 

She would like to get a loan to buy new furniture and a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her sales. 

She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and buy a larger quantity and variety of soft drinks to meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Konari

texts.en: Konari is 63 years old. He lives in the village of Bolkvi with his wife and his grown daughter and son-in-law. Konari is busy with agricultural activities. He grows grapes in his own vineyard and sells them in the fall season. He works hard the whole year and harvests the quality products which are sold to fruit retailers. Additionally, the family runs an animal husbandry business and breeds two calves. With this loan, Konari would like to purchase a tractor. He will use it to perform agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly in tilling and sowing seasons, and will be paid by the landlords. Konari has chronic health problems but, in spite of this, he has a strong will to generate income. He expects that this loan will significantly increase his family's funds and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor and use it to perform agricultural work on the lands of local farmers.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is a 29-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a heart patient and she always worries about his health. 

For 16 years, her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, Brac Pakistan. Afshan will use her portion to help her husband in purchasing a wood machine and some wood material for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business. With the net profit, he will open a new shop for his son.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a wood machine.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Бизнес Раисы уже несколько раз получал вливания от КИВА. После получения предыдущего кредита Раиса смогла увеличить его ассортимент и количество, за счет чего смогла заработать дополнительную прибыль. 
В этот раз Раиса хотела бы увеличить ассортимент банных халатов на продажу в преддверии праздников, когда многие покупают подарки для родных и близких. Для этого ей необходима сумма в 24 000 гривен. При помощи дополнительных средств направленных на закупку более разнообразного товара Раиса надеется со временем собрать дополнительную сумму денег от прибыли и открыть торговую точку побольше.
texts.en: Raisa's business has already received several boosts from KIVA . After receiving her last loan, Raisa was able to increase her product range and quantity,  thus enabling her to earn additional income . This time, Raisa would like to increase the variety of bath robes she has for sale in anticipation of the holidays, when many people buy gifts for loved ones. For this, she needs 24,000 hryvnia. With the help of this money, she will be able to offer a more diverse product Raisa hopes to eventually make enough money from this loan to open a larger shop.

loans.use: purchase bathrobes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase assorted pastries and candy for sale

loans.name: Naransolongo

texts.en:
Mrs. Naransolongo is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children, under 8, in their Ger (a traditional nomadic tent accommodation) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and currently unemployed. Her older child attends a local primary school, and the younger 2 go to kindergarten.

Naransolongo has been herding livestock with her husband since 2005. Her husband takes care of their livestock during winter when the livestock requires a lot of work, and he used to work as a part-time driver.

Naransolongo started producing traditional leather boots at home in 2010, and now provides a variety of traditional boots to her clients. She is now requesting 4,500,000 MNT to let her husband start a butcher shop business and increase their family income. She and her husband are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to let her husband start butcher shop business to increase their family income.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, esta casada y tiene Dos hijos todos ellos independientes,ocupa 3 habitaciones en su casa la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de queques con ayuda del esposo, con esta actividad se mantienen y cubren sus minimas necesidades

El crédito que requiere es para aumentar su capital ya que por época de navidad elaboraran panetones y tienen bastantes pedidos y no quieren perder clientela y mas al contrario poder ganar mas clientes y aumentar sus ingresos, así que neceista comprar harina, azucar, huevos y demas insumos para preparar panetones.

El sueño de Rosario es poder reunir un buen capital para su vejez y poder vivir sin trabajar en el futuro
texts.en:
Rosario is married and has 2 children who are both independent.  They occupy 3 bedrooms in her home which is located in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.  Currently, she works baking cakes with the help of her husband.  This work allows them to support themselves and cover their bare necessities.
