The loan she is seeking will be used to augment her capital because during the Christmas season, they make Christmas cakes.  They already have many orders, and they do not want to lose customers, but rather, they want to gain more customers and increase their revenues.  Therefore, they need to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, and other supplies to make the Christmas cakes.  

Rosario's dream is to save enough so that when she gets older she can live without working.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients to make christmas cakes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is the age of 40, living in Lahore with her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has grown old and his instruments as well, which are needed to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments.
 
Due to his low purchasing power, she requested a loan to empower his purchasing power so he can easily buy new instruments, such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror, and a revolving chair.

Rehana is growing old and does not have enough power to manage her household activities. She wants get her elder son married so that her daughter-in-law can hold all the household activities.
 
Rehana hopes that this loan will work positively, and she would be able to make some savings for the household expenses. Rehana says thanks to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy instruments for barber shop, such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror, and revolving chair.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 44-year-old widow. She lives with her two children in Ho Chi Minh City. To support her family, Hue earns an income by selling shellfish. She started this business three years ago. 

She would like to take out a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy a larger quantity of shellfish, with better quality, for selling. This will enable her to attract additional customers. 

Hue hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of shellfish, with better quality, for selling

loans.name: Manuela

texts.pt:
A senhora Manuela tem 41 anos de idade, solteira, vive com os dois filhos que estudam, é agente da Polίcia , afecto no governo da provincia há 19 anos.
O dinheiro de empréstimo será aplicado vai comprar material de construção: cimento, barrotes, varoes, pregos, arrame, para a reabilitação da sua casa.
 A esperança que ela tem é de continuar mais bens de garantia.
O seu desafio é de reabilitar a sua casa, pois, não se encontra em bom estado, pagar as prestacoes pontualmente e solicitar mais emprestimos para realizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 41 years old and single. She lives with her two children who attend school. She has been a police officer working for the provincial government for 19 years.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase construction supplies such as cement, beams, rods, nails and wire, so that she can renovate her house.
She hopes to continue acquiring more assets.
Her challenge is renovating her house, since it's currently in bad condition. Another challenge is making the repayments in a timely fashion and applying for more loans in order to achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, beams, rods, nails and wire.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar,viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día dedicándose por completo al comercio de llantas y auxilios mecánicos , ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia, debe pagar los gastos de alimentación,educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un galpon y oficina en un terreno que compró ya que desea abrir otro punto de venta de llantas para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Mario, es construir un departamento y unos galpones como deposito para tener mas comodidad y seguridad y también  mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la séptima vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la cuarta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has two children who attend school. They live in their own two-bedroomed house located in the Alto San Pedro area of La Paz.

Currently Mario works more than eight hours a day selling tires and mechanical accessories. This is his only source of income with which to support his family. He has to pay for food, education, and basic services.

He is seeking a loan to build a storage shed and office on a piece of land he has bought as he wants to open another place where he can sell tires and increase his income and improve his standard of living.

Mario's dream is to build a large store and several warehouses so he can have more stability, security and improve his income.

loans.use: Buy cement, tiles etc. to construct a storage shed and office

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 42 años, ella se dedica  a  la crianza de ganado para su posterior venta, ella vive en la localidad de Peñas, este préstamo es primero que tiene con la institución, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado camélido mejorado para tener una mejor producción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos, La Sra. Juana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, la Sra. Juana va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos, la Sra. Juana desea para su negocio crecer en la crianza y venta de ganado camélido, Ella es una persona muy  trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and works raising and selling llamas.  She lives in the town of Penas.  This loan is the first that she has had with this organization.  Juana will use the loan to buy a better llama in order to have better production.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to improve her income.  Juana is facing challenges in improving her business and her quality of life.  Juana will use the profits to improve her income.  Juana wants to grow her business of raising and selling llamas.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising person with a desire to get ahead and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a llama to raise.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene 39 años y es casado, estudia la carrera diplomado en educación superior, el número de miembros de su hogar es de dos personas su esposa y el sr. Hugo, trabaja para pagar sus estudios y su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio, estudia en  una de las universidades más reconocidas de la ciudad de La Paz, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución el Sr. Hugo va a usar este préstamo para distintos gastos que implica el estudiar como pago de estudios para diplomado para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo seis meses, el Sr. Hugo enfrenta retos en sus trabajo que son falta de experiencia, viven en la zona San Gabriel, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es obtener un título de diplomado y poder mejorar sus ingresos mensuales.
texts.en: Hugo is 39 years old and married, and is studying for a diploma in higher education. There are two people in his household, Hugo and his wife.  He works in order to pay for his studies, and his wife has a neighborhood store.  He is studying in one the most recognized universities in the city of La Paz.  This is the first loan that he has taken with this organization.  Hugo will use the loan for various expenses associated with studying, such as paying his tuition to complete his diploma, which will take six months.  Hugo is facing challenges in his work due to lack of experience.  They live in the San Gabriel region.  His wish when he finishes his studies is to obtain his diploma and improve his monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for his diploma studies.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, a hardworking 27-year-old woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, one son and two daughters. Her son and both of her daughters are studying, and her husband is an electrician by profession. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. As he is experienced in his work, he wants to generate more income by extending his work by purchasing more electrical equipment. 

Robina has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase such electrical equipment for his business and to satisfy the needs of the clients more professionally. Robina hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To pay for electrical equipment.

loans.name: Emma Beatriz

texts.es:
Emma es una joven de 20 años, casada con Cristian de 21, tienen una hija de 5 meses, viven juntos en casa de su suegra ubicada en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Cristian trabaja hace varios años en la carpintería de su padre, hacen muebles para el hogar. Emma desde que estaba en el colegio quiso ayudar en los ingresos de su hogar por eso hace 6 años ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, tiene clientes fijos  y realiza su trabajo de forma ambulante recorriendo las largas calles de su ciudad de lunes a domingo para ofrecer sus productos y también hacer labor de cobranza. 
Ahora ya tiene su propio hogar al que también aporta con estos ingresos. Es  clienta de Fundación Alternativa desde hace un año, le llamó mucho la atención el servicio y agilidad que da la institución. 
Solicita un crédito para invertir en cosméticos porque por esta temporada aumentan sus ventas, pues sus clientes compran cosméticos, perfumes y varios sets de belleza para entregar como regalos de navidad a sus seres queridos. Con las ganancias que obtenga, Emma quiere ahorrar para lograr comprarse un terreno y luego hacerse su propia casita, que es con lo que tanto ha soñado siempre. Emma agradece el apoyo de Fundación Alternativa quienes a través del producto Kiva han podido apoyar sus sueños y han hecho posible su crecimiento laboral.
texts.en:
Emma is a 20 year-old young woman who is married to Cristian who is 21 years old.  Together, they have a 5 month old daughter, and they live in her mother-in-law's home in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas.  For the past few years, Cristian has worked in his father's carpentry business, where they make household furniture.  

Since high school, Emma has wanted to help with household finances, which is why for the past 6 years, she has sold cosmetics from a catalog.  She has regular customers and everyday goes door to door down the long streets of her city to offer her products and collect payments.  She now has her her own home that she helps support with her earnings.  She is a client of the Fundacion Alternativa since last year.  The institution's service and flexibility grabbed her attention.  

She is seeking a loan to invest in cosmetics because during this season, her sales increase because her customers purchase cosmetics, perfumes and various beauty sets to give as gifts during Christmas.  With her earnings, Emma wants to save to be able to purchase a plot of land and later build her own house, which has always been her dream. 

Emma is grateful for the support she has received from Fundacion Alternativa, who through Kiva, have been able to support her dreams and help her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the peak season.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is a farmer who grows potatoes. She has been in the agricultural business since she was young. She began her business by selling potatoes and milk; later, she began to grow potatoes. Nowadays, she has a lot of experience growing potatoes. She also earns additional income from animal husbandry. 

Nargiza is married and has 4 children. Her husband helps her with the business. She works hard and hopes that in the future she will develop her business and earn more income. 

She is a well-bred person and was one of the best pupils at her school. Her children are smart. One of her children wants to get married. She must organize a wedding party for her child, but she doesn't have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to host a wedding party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to host a wedding party for her child.

loans.name: Reina Adelina

texts.es: La señora Reina es madre soltera, procreo 4 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan con ella en el negocio de la venta de tortillas, para el cual se levantan en la madrugada para preparar la masa y empezar a hacer las tortillas, cuando amanece ya tienen productos frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Este pequeño negocio es el sustento de doña Reina y sus hijas, es por eso que solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder invertir en maíz,  gas propano para la cocina industrial que ocupa para elaborar  dichas tortillas, así como también invertirá en gallinas para ofrecer en estas temporadas navideñas gallinas rellenas para las cenas familiares, para apoyarse con las ventas de las mismas.
texts.en: Reina is a single mother with 4 children, 2 of whom work with her in her business selling tortillas.  She gets up early in the morning to prepare the dough and make the tortillas, and by dawn she has fresh products to offer her customers.  This small business supports Reina and her children, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy corn, propane gas for the industrial stove on which she makes her tortillas, and chickens, so that she can sell stuffed chickens during the Christmas season for family dinners.  With these sales she will support herself.

loans.use: to buy corn, gas and chickens.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.pt:
Ezequiel, de 53 anos de idade, tem seis filhos que vivem com ele e dois que se encontram no lar. Todos estudam e, ele vive maritalmente, segurança na empresa privada onde trabalha em turnos.
O dinheiro de empréstimo vai comprar  mobilário da sala( comprar cadeiras sofás para uso em sua casa).
Diz que pretende adiquirir mais bens para o bem estar de sua famίlia, 
Reembolsar o crédito dentro de prazo estabelecido, solicitar mais para concretizar os seus sonhos e sustentar os estudos de seus filhos.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is 53 years old. He has six children who live with him and two children who live at home. All of them study. He's married and he's a security guard for a private company where he works by shifts.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase furniture for his living room (chairs and couches for using in his house).
He states that he intends to acquire more goods for his family's well-being.
He'll repay the loan within the scheduled time frame and apply for more loans so he can achieve his dreams and afford his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and couches.

loans.name: Eva

texts.pt:
A senhora Eva tem 43 anos de idade, viúva e vive na casa própria. Tem três filhos dos quais dois encontram-se a trabalhar e um a frequentar o nίvelsuperior. É criadora de frangos desde Janeiro de corrente ano na sua casa.
O dinheiro de empréstimo será aplicado para comprar pintos, ração e vitaminas para a criação de frangos para revenda.
A esperança da senhora Eva é de continuar com a criação de pintos e construir dependências para aluguer em sua casa como forma de aumentar a receita.
Os principais desafios da senhora eva são de  continuar com a criação de frangos e aumentar a capacidade da sua capoeira para seiscentos pintos.
texts.en:
Eva is 43 years old and a widow. She lives in a house that she owns. She has three children, two of whom are in the workforce and one is in college. She has been raising chickens in her house since last January.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins in order to raise chickens for re-selling.
Eva's hope is to continue raising chickens and build rooms for renting out in her house as a way of increasing her income.
Eva's main challenges are keeping her chicken raising business afloat and increasing the capacity of her coop so that it can hold 600 chicks.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Musilatu's Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Dansoman township, where the economy is based around trading. 

Musilatu makes her home here in Dansoman with one child; two of her other children are adults. She runs a business selling jewelry. Musilatu started her business with the first loan she received from ID-Ghana.

Musilatu is excited to be taking her sixth loan with ID-Ghana, after successfully repaying her previous loans.  She is planning to invest her new loan in purchasing jewelry to supply her customers in Dansoman. She will reinvest the profits in her business. She wants to have a successful and stable jewelry shop. 

The two members of this group need a total of 1,800 GHS to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small Hyundai truck, which consumes less fuel than other trucks, to start providing transportation service.

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
Shakhla, age 42 is a widowed woman from the village of Uzuntala. She lives alone in her own house. Shakhla earns her living through an agricultural business and grows tomatoes and cucumbers. She does all the needed work to ensure a good harvest and sells her products to local retailers. 

Besides this seasonal income, Shakhla trades clothing, shoes and underwear from her house and has loyal clients from her community. 

In order to improve her income, Shakhla is requesting this loan for purchasing two milk cows. She will start dairy farming and make cheese, yogurt and various products for selling as well as her own consumption. This initiative will increase her income and Shakhla will be able to improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and start dairy farming

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38-year-old married woman; she is the mother of four children. She has been embroidering by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband's income is low. For the sake of her children and to meet household expenses she started embroidering at home. A distributor provides her all raw materials for making embroidery; she completes her tasks, along with her daughters, over a wooden frame. 

Shamim also wants to sells embroidery in her town so that she can earn more income for her family. She has become expert in her art and wants to buy supplies so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy her own raw materials, such as sequins, pearls, spools, and silky threads, so that she can embroider more dresses to sell and can increase her family's income. 

Shamim hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for embroidery.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 35 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her whole family is depends on a single source of income, the embroidery shop which is owned by her husband. Her husband takes help from the ladies of his town, and he pays reasonable rewards for their services. He provides the embroidery material to those ladies who have need for a small job, and they provide only services to knit the embroidery. After some days he collects these knitted embroidery pieces and sells them in his shop. In this way, he has been getting maximum income for his family. 

His business is going well, and he wants to grow his business through more investment in the current business model. This way he will be able to get more profit and indirectly help needy women. Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to enable her husband to buy more material such as cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Shazia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for knitting embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es:
Alonso es un microempresario cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Alonso tiene 48 años, vive en unión libre desde hace 8 años y tiene 4 hijos;  de los cuales sólo dependen de él sus hijas de 16 y 7 años. Vive en casa de sus padres y ahí mismo tiene un negocio de tortas al cual se dedica desde hace 20 años.

Actualmente atiende por la ventana de un cuarto de su casa vendiendo tortas, hamburguesas, hot dogs, gringas, sincronizadas, alambres y próximamente quesadillas y tacos; ahí, su esposa le ayuda con la venta. Abre de lunes a domingo de 10 am a 10 pm, y tiene muchos clientes ya que la gente lo conoce y lo sigue por la antigüedad, calidad y buen precio que les ofrece. 

Este préstamo le serviría para arreglar su negocio y dar mejor servicio a mis clientes, ya que actualmente solo tiene una barra provisional para que los comensales. Gracias a su negocio ha logrado amueblar bien su casa y darme lujos con mi familia ya que no les falta nada. Su reto es poner más negocios y darlos a trabajar para que en un futuro sólo los supervise.
texts.en:
Alonso is a small businessman working with Kubo Financiero. He is 48 years old, is in a common-law relationship and has four children. Only his 16- and 17-year old daughters are still dependent on him. He lives with his parents and has run a bakery business out of the house for 20 years.

He currently sells the following items from one of the windows of the house: pies, hamburgers, hot dogs, various Mexican dishes, and soon...quesadillas and tacos. His wife helps with sales. He is open seven days a week from 10 am to 10 pm and has many customers as the local people know him and have been customers for years because of the quality of the food and fair prices.

Alonso will use the loan to renovate the business and provide his customers with better service. At the moment he only has a temporary bar for his guests.

Thanks to his business he has managed to furnish his house well and provide his family with a few extras. His goal is to open more businesses and employ people so that in the future he only has to supervise them.

loans.use: To renovate his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, none of whom is at school. For the past year, Martha has been working hard to manage her hotel business, which sells cooked food.

To help expand her business, Martha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy utensils for the hotel, and will help Martha to generate greater profits which will be used to buy clothes for her children. Martha hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a business of selling soft drinks. 

Martha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her hotel business

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a a hard-working man who lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

For over two years, he has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000, he wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en:
Hajiran is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, she will not be able to meet the expenses of her household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase more reels of threads along with the packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Hajiran hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads along with the packs of buttons, zippers, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband and has ten years of experience in this field.  She has become famous in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. 

Shahnaz wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand for these products at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of further expanding her business in the future. She is motivated by her desire to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health care.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits, and beverages

loans.name: Nogoye's Group

texts.fr:
Inauguré depuis le 13 décembre 2008, ce groupe évolue grâce à l'élan de solidarité des membres qui font comme activité principale le petit commerce.
Khady, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants des filles. Elle fait comme activité principale le petit commerce. Avec le prêt, elle va acheter du piment, du poivre, de l'ail des oignons etc. qu'elle va revendre au détail sur une étale installée devant chez elle. Elle fait comme activité parallèle de l'embouche ovine. Elle va acheter 02 moutons à 20 000 F chaque qu'elle va revendre au bout de 06 mois.
Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle va renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Since its creation on December 13, 2008, this group has been developing thanks to the growing solidarity between its members, who are all small-scale retailers. 

Khady, who is standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 50 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters. 

Her main business is small-scale retail. With the loan, she will buy chili, pepper, garlic, onions, etc., that she will re-sell to retail clients from a display set up in front of her home. Additionally, she also fattens sheep. She is going to buy 2 sheep for 20,000 F each and re-sell them after 6 months. The resulting income will help build up her savings.

loans.use: to sell condiments: chili, pepper, garlic and onions.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa esta separada del esposo y tiene cuatro hijos todos ellos independientes,ocupa cinco habitaciones en su casa la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente percibe el ingresos de su movilidad, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de edredones y colchas para aumentar sus ingresos

El crédito que requiere es para aumentar su capital y traer juguetes para Navidad para de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Maria Luisa es poder juntar algo de dinero para su vejez ya que no cuenta con seguro ni tiene mas ingresos que el de su propio trabajo.

Es la septima vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la quinta vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Maria Luisa is separated from her husband and has four grown children who live in her house located in the Tembladerani zone of La Paz city. Today her income comes from a taxi, and she also sells quilts and bedspreads to increase her earnings. The loan she requires is to increase her capital and bring Christmas toys and in this way increase her income. Maria Luisa's dream is to be able to gather some savings for her old age as she doesn't have a pension or income other than her own work. This is the 7th loan she seeks from IMPRO and her 5th from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 25-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as faithful. 

Samuel operates a retail store where he makes and sells jikos to earn a living. He will use the 12,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house. In  the future, he hopes to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sonia Liseth

texts.es:
Doña Sonia es una mujer casada de 40 años de edad la cual tiene 7 años de educación gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres tanto económico como moral a pesar de las dificultades en el tiempo de su juventud. Ella es agricultora y ganadera desde hace 3 años ya que sus padres se dedican a lo mismo y en su familia el trabajo de la tierra y ganadería es una tradición y único medio de ingreso para el fortalecimiento de la economía en el hogar. Ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales viven con ellos como también viven 2 sobrinos involucrándose en días feriados y vacaciones ya que ellos estudian. Ella también es comerciante ya que tiene una pequeña pulpería en la cual vende los derivados de la leche mismos que son producidos por ellos.  El terreno que ella cultiva y trabaja como también donde tiene sus vacas es propio el cual lo obtuvo gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres y otra parte por medio de una compra ubicado a 4 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en vehículo ya que al mismo tiempo transportan la materia prima. 
Sus sueños es tener una hacienda, tener reces de calidad y poder ser una de las mejores productoras de leche de la zona. Como Madre ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, con carreras universitarias que ayuden a su desarrollo y fortalecimiento para desempeñarse en cualquier rama de trabajo que le sea asignada. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento para poder empezar a fortalecer su sueño con el cual comprara 2 novillas de leche mejorando su ganado y la producción en cantidad que podrá obtener mediante esta adquisición
texts.en:
Sonia is a 40 year old married woman. She has 7 years of education thanks to the efforts of her parents for both financial and moral support despite the difficulties during her youth. She has been working in agricultural and cattle for 3 years as her parents work in the same fields. In her family working the land and with livestock is a tradition and the only means of income for strengthening the household finances. 

She is the mother of 4 children who live with them and there are also 2 nephews living with them during holidays and vacation as they are students. She is also a trader as she has a small store selling dairy products which are produced by them. 

The land that she cultivates and works and also has her cows is her own obtained thanks to an inheritance from her parents and partly through a purchase. It is located 4 kilometers from her home and the trip is made by vehicle at the same time as they transport the raw material.

Her dreams are to have a farm, to have quality cattle and to be able to be one of the best producers of milk in the area. As a mother she dreams of seeing her children become professionals with university degrees that help their growth and development to work in any field of work they might be held responsible for.

So she is asking today for a loan in order to begin to strengthen her dream with which she will buy 2 milk cows improving her livestock and the amount of product she can obtain through the purchase.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows in order to improve her milk production

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives with his wife, mother and two grown up children in Vanadzor town. For 10 years, Karen has worked as a taxi driver using his own car. He mainly drives the Yerevan-Vanadzor route and has a lot of customers. They prefer to travel such a far distance in his taxi since he drives attentively and very carefully. 

Karen is asking for a loan to do some repairs to his car since it is seriously damaged and Karen isn’t able to continue his business.
Karen has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to other credit products. The loan is very important for this hard working man who does his best to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his car

loans.name: Rassaki

texts.fr: Homme de 37ans, mr Rassaki a pour femme une coiffeuse et père d'01 enfant scolarisé. Il est maitre tailleur et a ouvert son atelier en 1998. Il revend aussi des pagnes. Pour agrandir son stock, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de pagnes et une machine à broder. Le profit lui permettra d'assurer une bonne scolarisation à son enfant et plus tard ouvrir une boutique de pagnes.
texts.en:
Rassaki is 37 years old, married to a hairstylist and has one child who is attending school. He is a master tailor and opened up his workshop in 1998. He also sells pagnes [traditional fabric wraps]. 

In order to increase his stock, he is seeking his first loan to buy more pagnes and an embroidery machine. The profits will allow him to ensure that his child gets a good education, and later on to open up a pagne boutique.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 32-year-old married woman. For many years, she and her husband have run a business selling milk. She keeps three buffaloes and two cows and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. Samina has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Samina has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for another loan of PKR 40,000, which will allow her to purchase an additional cow. Samina is hopeful that this loan will be productive and bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Marixsa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Marixsa a sus 43 años de edad, continua con su lucha por mejorar su casa, su compañero de vida la apoya con  los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja como Albañil, ella en cambio labora como Operaria de un empresa distribuidora de pollo, con este credito que solicita compra materiales como: Bolsa de Cemento, Arena, ademas de repellar pondra parte del piso por lo que comprara ceramica y bondex. doña Marixsa espera seguir contando con el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado en estos años.
texts.en:
Doña Marixsa is 43 years old and continues to strive to improve her home. Her life partner helps her with household expenses, as he works as a bricklayer. She in return works as an operator for a chicken distribution company. 

With this loan, she will purchase materials such as a bag of cement and sand, as well as tiles and Bondex in order to plaster part of the floor. Doña Marixsa hopes to continue to count on the support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided her in recent years.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Natsag

texts.en:
Natsag is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 3 year old son in their ger, a traditional tent house, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Batmonh is 34 and they run their family business together. Her son Monhbat is 3 and just started going to kindergarten. 

Natsag started her own business, making traditional boots at home in 2010. Along with her husband she started their family business, a small variety goods mobile retail store and has been successfully running it for living. She has still been producing hand made leather boots by order along with her family business. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her business to increase their sales and income. She is a hardworking, honest and talkative woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman with three children. She rents a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase six bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en: Fahmeeda is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. For three years, Fahmeeda has been running business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Manwer

texts.en: Manwer is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 3 years of experience in this field.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her general store.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 35-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three buffaloes and two cows in milk, and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She has five children and needs to improve her business to meet their demands, including food, clothing and health. 

Currently, she requests a loan of 40,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy one more buffalo. It will help her to increase her sales. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es: José de 36 años de edad  reside junto a su grupo familiar conformado por  su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos de 11 años, 8 años y 7 años de edad. José es un hombre visionario quien desea que sus hijos se superen y puedan tener mejores oportunidades de vida.  José trabaja como albañil desde hace mucho tiempo y de esa forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pintura, cemento y arena ya que desea pavimentar y pintar su vivienda. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así hacer las mejoras de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: José, 36 years old, lives with his family, composed of his life partner and his 3 children aged 11, 8, and 7. José is a visionary man who wants his children to get ahead and have better opportunities in life. José has worked as a mason for a long time, and this is how he supports his household. With the goal of improving his family's living conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of paint, cement, and sand, as he wants to pave and paint his home. He hopes to be able to count on this support and make these improvements to his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase paint, cement, and sand to pave and paint his home.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. Hasifa has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells all kinds of shoes. 

To help expand her business, Hasifa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more shoes and increase her stock, which should help Hasifa to generate greater profits and to supplement her family's basic needs. Hasifa hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Hasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her ninth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya is 58 years old, a vigorous, married woman and the mother of five children. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for the past seven years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Suraiya’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 25000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her second loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es: José de 52 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 10 años, 6 años y 3 años de edad.  Desde muy pequeño aprendió el oficio de albañilería lo cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Muchas personas confían en su trabajo ya que él es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa la cual es muy sencilla pero propia. Desea mejorar algunas partes de la vivienda ya que con el tiempo y la falta de mantenimiento han dañado el techo y el piso. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y lámina galvanizada para hacer las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old and lives in his home on his own property with his spouse and their three children aged 10, 6 and 3 years old. Since he was young, he has learned the masonry trade, from which he receives most of his earnings. Many people trust in his work because he is a responsible, honest and hard-working man. With  a great amount of effort, he has been able to build his house, which is very simple but his own. 

He hopes to make some improvements to his home because with time and a lack of maintenance, his roof and floor have become damaged. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, gravel and galvanized metal sheeting to make these improvements as soon as he can.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, and galvanized metal sheets to repair his home's roof and floor.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 38-year-old married woman. She has eight children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 20 years old. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail store where she sells maize, beans and other items to earn a living. She will use the Kes 7,900 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is 33 years old, a married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Since 2004, she has worked selling used clothes and electronic household appliances.  At the same time, she runs a small bakery which provides her family with a good, promising income. Rima is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation.  She puts a huge effort in helping her husband cover their family's increasing needs.  She is well known in her region for her wide business talent; that's why she is recommended by most of her customers.

Rima is acquiring her tenth loan cycle, from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials for her bakery, such as flour and oils, and to buy the diesel her family needs to keep warm during the coming winter season. 

Her previous loan was invested in her clothes business to increase capital with newly released items.  It had a positive impact on her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials for her bakery, such as flour and oils, and to buy the diesel her family needs to keep warm during the winter.

loans.name: Olga Rosa

texts.es:
Olga Rosa tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Púcara, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica al comercio de frutales, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que está ubicado en la sierra norte del Perú.

Son una familia que se esfuerza en su labor, tienen una bodega que se dedican a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de abarrotes leche, azúcar, menestras para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Olga Rosa is 62 years old and lives with her husband and her children in Pucara district where the climate is warm and its population is dedicated to the fruit business. It's located 2 hours from the city of Jaen, in the northern mountains of Peru.

They are a family that works hard in their beer and soft drink store. Olga Rosa has requested a loan of 1,000 new sols to invest in purchasing groceries, including milk, sugar, and beans to expand their business and, thus, to increase the family's income.

loans.use: buy groceries, including milk, sugar, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a housewife in a small village of Maynaguri. She is 34 years old and married to Jatish, who is a blacksmith. Anita and her husband both have received secondary education.  They have two children. 

Anita and her husband decided to take this loan to invest in their existing blacksmith business by purchasing raw materials for their business. Anita’s husband has experience in this field. They usually make different household tools for daily use, like scissors, knives, nails, etc., and sell them at the market.  There is a great demand for their products in the locality. 

With the profit from this business, Anita wants to give her children a good education and a bright future. Anita is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her husband’s blacksmith business.

loans.name: Mini

texts.en:
Mini is a very strong-minded 22-year-old housewife of Dhupguri town. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are receiving an education. She wants her children to lead a very successful life with a good education. Mini is illiterate, so giving an education to her children is very important. 

Her husband is a farmer, involved in the agricultural business, usually cultivating bananas and selling them to the market. Mini gives assistance to him in his business. Mini wants this loan to buy banana suckers (seedlings) and fertilizer to cultivate a new crop of bananas in their field. With this profit, she can purchase more land to increase her business. 

In the future, she dreams to build a beautiful concrete house, as they do not have a concrete house of their own.  She is grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: to buy banana suckers (seedlings) and fertilizer to cultivate a new crop of bananas.

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra is from the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and one child. Her child is too small for education. She has completed her education until grade X (grade 10). Her husband is not educated, but can sign his name. 

Suchitra is rearing cows, and she sells their dairy products to the market. Her husband is associated with agricultural work. Though they both are the earning members of the family, their earning is insufficient for them. 

Suchitra decided to grow her business by purchasing more cows and selling more dairy products in the market for making more profit for her family. This business is profitable for her because there is a lot of demand for dairy products in her area.  Due to lack of money, she couldn’t buy more cows and was unable to grow her business, so she decided to take loan.

With the profit from this business, she wants to build a cattle farm and make her family financially strong. She has been running this business for the last few years, so she is experienced in this field; that will help her to earn profit easily. She is very happy for becoming a member of BJS, and she is also very much thankful to Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to sell dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Tamina

texts.en:
Tamina, age 41, and her husband, Adisul, age 49, are from the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. They have four children and of those, three children are studying in school. The other one is running his own vegetable business. Tamina is a homemaker, and her husband is associated with agricultural work. They are not educated, but know how to sign their names. Her husband’s business is not so much profitable for them to run their family. 

So, Tamina decided to help her husband by earning money for her family. She decided to purchase a milch cow (cow which gives milk) for herself, and sell milk in the market and start earning for her family. She chose this business because in her area, demand for the milk is very high, so it’s a profitable business for her.

Her future dream is to purchase a shop on her own where they can sell the milk on a large scale. She is a hardworking woman. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan and helping her to start her new business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to sell milk in the market.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en: Hafeezan deals in business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of profit. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs.15,000 to purchase another calf. It’s her 6th loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman. She has six kids and she lives at a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For years, she has operated a milk-selling business, selling from home to her restaurant operators and neighbours. In addition she sells water and fish.  She dreams of buying a land and expanding her farming in the future. 

With the Kshs. 40,000 she wants to purchase packets of milk for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase packets of milk for resale.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 47-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 36, is a married woman. She started her business of hand embroidery to contribute to the family income. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She has four daughters and three sons. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet its growing demand of embroidery she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors so she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way she can manage to meet the demands of her customers on time which will help in generating more income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.es:
Joselito tiene 39 años de edad vive junto a su familia en el distrito de la Matanza una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a los cultivos de arroz, y limón, comercio de animales menores, ubicado en Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la venta de animales menores cuyes, patos, gallinas; su negocio esta ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para compra de alimentos balanceados y des esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Joselito is 39 years old and lives with his family in Matanza district, a quiet community. Its population is dedicated to cultivating rice and lemons, and commerce in small animals. It is located in Morropon, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. 

With the help of his wife, he sells small livestock such as guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens. His business is located in the backyard of his home. He requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced animal feed and thus have better products to offer to his clients, which will generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a balanced diet to fatten up his small livestock

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus nietos en la la zona rural de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, agricultura y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Juanita como así la conocen en su zona nos explica, que se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de animales menores, contribuyendo con su esposo en el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Ella ha solicitado un préstamo a Edyme Altenativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para sus vacas y así tener una mejor producción de leche para ofrecerlo en el mercado de la zona y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 66 years old. She lives with her husband and their grandchildren in a rural zone of Cayalti. Its population works in cultivating sugar cane, rice, agriculture, and business. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru.

Juanita, as she is known in her area, raises dairy cattle and sells small animals, contributing with her husband to the sustenance of the household.

She has applied to Edyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN to buy balanced feed for her cows and thus have a better production of milk to offer in the local market, and in this way to have greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for better milk production from her cows.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en: Bashiran is a 41-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Mebelyng, es madre soltera de dos niños de 5 y 2 años, originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Es una mujer trabajadora y muy luchadora, tiene 30 años de edad y cuenta con 13 años de experiencia en el ramo de la belleza. Hace dos años estableció  su propio salón de belleza, construido de madera y zinc, ubicado en un lugar donde transita mucha gente, lo cual le permite tener buena clientela con los servicios que ofrece de peinados, cortes de cabello para hombres y mujeres, alisados, planchados, pistoleado, maquillaje, entre otros. Cada diciembre emplea a dos ayudantes por la alta demanda que tiene durante la temporada. 

Ella solicita el préstamo para adquirir una plancha de cabello y otras herramientas propias de belleza, que le permitirán atender la demanda que se le aproxima.

En Pana Pana ya ha tenido dos préstamos como parte del grupo solidario, con lo cual ha ido fortaleciendo su pequeño negocio con productos de belleza y compró dos vitrinas. 

Nelsy: Es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que ha establecido una pequeña pulpería donde vende gaseosas, agua purificada, jugos, tortillas y enchiladas que ella misma prepara. Tiene una niña de 5 años y es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. El pequeño local es alquilado y paga cincuenta córdobas por día. Estudia los sábados en la modalidad de secundaria acelerada porque quiere llegar a ser una profesional en el futuro. Sueña con tener su casa propia, construida de cemento, pues ahorita tiene que pagar alquiler. Solicita financiamiento para surtir su pulpería. 

Leonarda: Es madre soltera de dos hijos de 12 y 6 años. Ella tiene una pulpería en su vivienda donde vende chiverías, pan, gaseosas, pero además vende frijoles cocidos, nacatamales y tortilla de maíz. Está solicitando el préstamos para incrementar el inventario de su pulpería además de comprar un quintal de frijoles para la venta de frijoles cocidos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda grande con varios productos que le generen más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mebelyng is a single mother of two children, ages 5 and 2. She is a native of the city of Bilwi. She is hard-working and striving. She is 30 years old and has 13 years of experience in the area of beauty. Two years ago she established her own beauty salon, constructed of wood and zinc, located in a place where many people pass by, which allows her to have a good customer base with the services that she offers of hair styling, haircuts for men and women, straightening, ironing, blow-drying, and makeup, among others. Every December she employs two assistants because of the high demand that she has during that season.

She is applying for the loan to acquire a hair iron and other beauty tools of her own, which will allow her to respond to the demand that she experiences.

She has already had two loans from Pana Pana as part of her communal group. With them, she has strengthened her little business with beauty  products and bought two display cases.

Nelsy: She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has established a little grocery story where she sells soft drinks, purified water, juices, and tortillas and enchiladas that she herself prepares. She has a daughter who is five years old, and she is the coordinator of the communal group. Her little shop is rented, and she pays 50 cordobas a day. On Saturdays she goes to school in an accelerated secondary program, because in the future she wants to have a career. She dreams of having her own house, made of cement, since now she has to pay rent. She is applying for a loan to stock her grocery store.

Leonarda: She is a single mother of two children, ages 12 and 6. She has a grocery store in her home, where she sells snacks, bread, and soft drinks, but in addition she sells cooked beans, nactamales (Nicaraguan tamales), and corn tortillas. She is applying for the loan to increase the inventory of her grocery store, in addition to buying a quintal (about 100 lbs) of beans to sell as cooked beans. Her dream is to eventually have a big store with various products that will generate more income for her.

loans.use: to acquire a hair iron and other beauty tools of her own, which will allow her to respond to the demand that she experiences.

loans.name: Ramaz
loans.use: to purchase a car and start firewood transportation from the forest.

loans.name: Monowara

texts.en:
Monowara is a 35-year-old married woman who has two children. Both of them receive an education. Monowara passed class V (grade 5), while her husband is illiterate, just knowing how to sign his name. Her husband is 42 years old. 

Monowara is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. They live in the small town of Dhupguri. They own a small plot of land on which her husband cultivates crops. As the plot of land belongs to them, the whole profit comes to them only. 

Monowara has taken the loan to buy seeds for potato cultivation so that they can enhance their business and can cultivate another variety of vegetable and can earn more. 

They dream to give a good and bright future to their children. Monowara also hopes they can shift to a pakka house (a house made of bricks and cement) from a kaccha house (a house made of straw, bamboo, etc.). They are thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending the helping hand.

loans.use: to buy seeds for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila, her husband and their four children live in the small town of Dhupguri.  All the children are educated. Both Laila and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. 

Laila takes care of animals and earns money by selling the milk and milk products, while her husband is engaged in selling vegetables at the market. Both Laila and her husband struggle a lot and try to earn money so that their children don’t need to struggle like them. 

From the beginning, Laila has reared different animals like hens, goats, etc. Now she wants to earn more, so she has applied to BJS for a loan of INR 15,000 so that she can purchase a cow. She can sell its milk and milk products in the market. 

Laila is a very courageous woman, and she is confident that one day will come when she will not require any loan from anyone; that she can be self-sufficient to earn money, support her family and fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, Uganda. She has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her business, which operates in cooked food for the hotel.

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food stuff for the hotel and will help Brenda to generate greater profits. This will, in turn, be used to pay fees for her children. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a fridge.

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase food stuff for the hotel.

loans.name: Jose Genaro

texts.es: José de 47 años de edad reside en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos. José trabaja como vigilante desde hace mucho tiempo  y es así como mantiene su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones y las de su esposa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir la compra de cemento, arena y lámina galvanizada ya que desea encementar el piso y reparar el techo de la vivienda deteriorado por las lluvias.
texts.en:
José, 47, lives in his own house with his life partner who works in domestic help. 

José,has worked as a security guard for a long time which is how he maintains his home. 

With the desire to improve his and his wife's conditions, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and galvanized sheet so he can pave the floor and fix the roof which has deteriorated with rain.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and galvanized sheet so he can pave the floor and fix the roof.

loans.name: Simon Honorato

texts.es:
Simon en un hombre muy trabajador en cual se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, el posee una pequeña parcela en la ciudad de Camana, que es la ciudad donde el vive actualmente. Simón le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que siempre esta al pendiente del crecimiento de su cultivo, por ello cree que le va bien.

Simon está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, brindar mantenimiento al cultivo, entre otros; lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ser un gran agricultor”.
texts.en:
Simon is a very hardworking man who has dedicated himself to agriculture for many years. He owns a small plot of land in the city of Camana, which is the city where he currently lives. Simon spends about 9 hours per day cultivating it as he is always watching over the growth of his crops, and he feels it is going well because of that. 

Simon is grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have provided him, he can purchase manure and fertilizer, maintain his crops, etc. which allows him to continue to strive to realize his greatest dream: "To be a great farmer."

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio de animales menores y ganadería, que pertenece a Morropon, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia que se dedican a la venta de animales menores pavos, gallinas, cerdos y chivos, conocidos en la zona por la labor que realizan. Vidal ha solicitado u préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales menores para llevar a ofrecerlos a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vidal is 52 years old and lives with his wife in the rural area of La Matanza, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce in small animals, and animal husbandry. It is located in Morropon, two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Along with his family, he dedicates himself to the sale of small livestock such as turkeys, hens, pigs, and goats. They are known in the area for the work they do. Vidal has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase more animals to bring to sell in villages adjacent to his community and earn additional income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock such as pigs and goats

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 59-year-old married man.  He has 6 children between the ages of 10 and 25 years old.  He describes himself to be God-fearing.  He operates a carpentry business where he sells tables, chairs, etc. to earn a living.  He will use the KES 7,900 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house.  He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Fallah is a 22-year-old Iraqi client. He is single and lives with his family, which is composed of two members. Fallah is the sole provider of his family.

Fallah is a carpenter who specializes in making doors, windows, and furniture. After working for several years and gaining experience at a carpenter's shop, Fallah established his own business in 2012. He has already hired an employee. Thanks to his clean work and affordable prices, Fallah became well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Fallah is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy a specialized wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory. Fallah is aiming to grow his business and to increase his profits so that he may provide himself a stable career and a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy a specialized wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es: Natividad tiene 47 años de edad y es el soporte económico para su hogar. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a sus hijos de 19, 15 y 13 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Natividad se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y cereales. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su principal patrimonio es su humilde vivienda la cual necesita un muro de retención lo antes posible ya que las lluvias están desbordando el terreno y afecta su vivienda. Además, desea hacer un servicio sanitario ya que el que tiene se encuentra en malas condiciones. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y lámina para hacer el muro y reparar el baño sanitario lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Natividad is 47 years old and the economic support for her household. She lives in very modest circumstances with her children, ages 19,15 and 13, who are in school. Natividad sells fruits, vegetables and grains. This business is her main source of income. 

Her main asset is her modest house, which needs a retaining wall as soon as possible, as the rains are overflowing her plot of land and affecting her home. In addition she wishes to do work the bathroom, as the one she has is in poor repair. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, gravel and sheet metal for building the wall and repairing the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and sheet metal in order to build a retaining wall and repair the bathroom.

loans.name: Darkul

texts.ru: Даркул 22 года, замужем. У Даркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Даркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 2 года назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Даркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 1 коза, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Даркул входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 3 человека. Даркул является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Даркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Даркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку дома в селе.
texts.en: Darkul is 22 and married, with a secondary education. She raises livestock as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started two years ago with the purchase of cattle for 30,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her holding now includes three milk cows, two horses, one goat and 10 sheep, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Darkul is a member of the group "Almaluu" along with two other people. With the intention of further developing her business, she has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy calves to increase her head count. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of the size of her herd, and to save toward the purchase of a house in the village.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Parizat

texts.ru: Паризат 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Паризат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Паризат занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Паризат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 овцы, 3 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Паризат входит в группу "Алмалуу", в эту группу входят еще 3 человека. Паризат является четвертым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Паризат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Паризат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Parizat is 26 and married with three children. She has a secondary education and raises livestock as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started five years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her holding now contains two milk cows, two sheep and three goats, with a monthly income of 7,000 KGS. Parizat belongs to the Almaluu group along with three other people. With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase sheep to increase her head count. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of her herd and to save toward her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Deysi Medalith

texts.es:
Deysi Medalith tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña para luego comercializarlo a la Empresa azucarera de la zona, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen un pequeño negocio de artículos de ferretería y repuestos de moto, son una familia joven y emprendedora, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con diversos articulo de ferretería tubos, calaminas, clavos, etc y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi Medalith is 19 years old and lives with her husband in Lagunas district. Its inhabitants grow sugarcane to sell at the sugar company in the area, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast.

She and her husband have a small business selling hardware items and motorcycle spare parts. They are a young and enterprising family. She has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles for stocking their business with various hardware items such as pipes, sheet metal, nails, etc., in order to generate   greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy hardware items: sheet metal, pipes, nails, for stocking her business.

loans.name: Joan Manuel

texts.es:
Joan tiene 20 años y vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja como empleado de seguridad en un fundo agrícola y con este trabajo puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, Jon cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque su responsabilidad y sobre todo su honestidad.

Joan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder colocar el piso de la habitación donde vive y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and lives in the city is Ica. He works as a security guard at a farm, and with this work can have income so that he can get ahead in life. Joan believes his work is going well because of his sense of responsibility, and especially his honesty.
