He is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided him he will be able to buy construction materials to install a floor in the room where he lives. This way he can improve his quality of life and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality,"To have my own house."

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Khemesse's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 19 femmes fait parti du Banc villageois créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé de membres dynamiques et solidaires qui font comme activités le commerce et l'embouche.
Khemesse, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 01 garçon. Avec le prêt, elle compte faire de l'embouche ovine. elle fait cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le BV. Elle va acheter un mouton à 40 000 F qu'elle va élever et avec le reste de l'argent acheter de la nourriture de bétail et aussi pourvoir aux soins vétérinaires. Elle va élever le mouton et au bout de 05 mois le revendre à 75 000 F.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce son épargne et va entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 19 women is part of the 'banc villageois' created on December 13, 2008. It is composed of energetic members in solidarity with one another. Their businesses involve commerce and livestock farming. 

Khemesse, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of ten children, including one boy. With this loan, she intends to fatten sheep. She has been in this business since joining the 'banc villageois'. She is going to purchase a head of sheep at 40,000 francs that she will raise. With the rest of the money, she will purchase feed and also be able to afford veterinary care. She will raise the sheep and sell it for 75,000 francs after five months. With the profits, she bolsters her savings and will care for her children.

loans.use: to raise sheep

loans.name: Akolly

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits d'alimentation générale, mr Akolly sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit. Il a démarré en 2003 et s'approvisionne à Lomé. Il espère réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans l'activité et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille(âgé de 38ans, il est marié et père d'un enfant de 04ans).
texts.en: To purchase grocery items, Mr. Akolly is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. Having started off in 2003, he supplies himself from Lomé. He hopes to reinvest his extra profits in his business and do his utmost to meet the needs of his family. Mr. Akolly is 38 years old, married, and a father of a 4-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza  is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cream relaxers and braids. She generates additional income from farming. She works from home seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin is a 23-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as God fearing. He operates a motorcycle transport business whereby he transports customers using his motorcycle. He will use the KES 7,900 loan to buy a solar lamp to light his house. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Enji Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Enji's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. Zeinab is a 38-year-old married mother of four children. She works in the clothes selling business to support her family, where she is responsible for the living of six family members. Zeinab's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise. She will increase the winter collection with new released items.

Zeinab's previous loans were invested in switching her business type from the used clothes trade to new items exported from Turkey. She is the first lady from the right. As for the other group members, Nawal is in the middle, and Samiha is the first from the left.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special winter items

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is a 35-year-old married person who is raising two children together with his wife. Akif is a cattle breeder with more than 15 years of experience. He purchases small calves and then fattens and raises them. After six months, he resells the grown cattle in the central city market. He applied for a 2000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and increase his income. This loan will allow him to improve the life of his family. He has a good loan history and this is going to be his fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and increase his income

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and earns a living running her own business, and she's been selling maize for 12 years. She gets help from her daughter who helps to sell and serve customers better. In this way, Cecilia is able to generate enough income to contribute towards her household expenses. Currently she is asking for the loan amount of 2,000 GHS to buy two big bags of maize to sell to customers. This will also allow her to have enough stock to meet the demand for products and to face the various challenges caused by unexpected rises in maize price. This affects her finances and her customers since the prices are very variable and unstable. By doing this she will be able to increase sales and the income she makes. 

Cecilia says she wants to continue working hard to move her business forward. She wants to fulfill her dream of owning a supply shop, which will give her better profits and income to improve her family's well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two big bags of maize and sell to customers.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is 23 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past five years, Zaid has been working hard to manage her jewelry shop, which deals in different kinds of jewelry. To help expand her business, Zaid has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials like beads and will help Zaid to generate greater profits and to be able to pay fees for her child. Zaid hopes that in the future she will be able to start a wholesale shop. 

Zaid is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy materials for her jewelry shop

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a 29-year-old married man with one daughter. He deals in the business of animal sales. He buys animals, such as baby goats and calves, at low prices, raises them, and sells them out in the market at higher prices. 

Yashar is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. He makes enough through his business to contribute to the family income. However, he needs to improve his business to bear his household expenses. For this reason, he contacted Aqroinvest CU and applied for a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase another calf. With this loan, he will definitely expand his business and increase his income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 51 years of age. He is a married person. For the last two years, he has been working growing fruits and vegetables with his wife. They have their own plot of land, located 10 minutes from their home. Every day Ibrahim goes out with his wife; they work hard, but with enthusiasm, they look after and clean their vegetables in the belief that they will have an excellent harvest. With an excellent harvest, they can generate a higher income. 

Ibrahim is in need of a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy farming supplies. He needs to buy fertilizers, seeds and other items.

In the future, Ibrahim dreams of expanding his crops by planting and growing a larger quantity of fruits and vegetables. This way, he can earn a higher income that would allow him to prosper with his family and to give them better opportunities in life. Ibrahim wants to educate his children so that, in the future, they become prepared visionaries who will look after the inheritance Ibrahim will leave them.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, including fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moureen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 1 year, Moureen has been working hard to manage her matooke business, which deals in the sale of matooke. 

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bunches of matooke and will help Moureen to generate greater profits and pay house rent. Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to  buy a sawing machine. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"




"

loans.use: to buy more bunches of matooke.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 20 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Constance has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which deals in sewing different designs of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Constance has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials and a sewing machine and will help Constance to generate greater profits  and be able to construct a house. Constance hopes that in the future she will be able to go for further studies. 

Constance is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 19 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Getrude has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which deals with chicken. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more feed for the chicken. It will help Getrude to generate greater profits and help her to provide necessitates for her family. Getrude hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for the chicken.

loans.name: Receb

texts.en: Receb is 58 years of age and married. He is an established farmer who has done this work for 24 years. On his farm, he rears dairy cows and poultry. Receb's sons help him in this business. He enjoys farming, because, as he says, it's a source of income for him. In order to expand his business, Receb  asked the Aqroinvest CU for a loan in the amount of 1,900 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to buy cows for cattle breeding. This loan will help him purchase a dairy cow, which will add more income and better his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cows for cattle breeding

loans.name: Keydy

texts.es:
La joven es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, desde hace 6 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y también sale a vender a diversos lugares aledaños. 
Keydy necesita el préstamo para la compra blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, chores, etc. y tener suficiente producto para la venta ya que en esta época navideña sus clientes le demandan mas mercadería. 
Keydy con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes, desea poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Keydy espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Keydy is a hardworking and responsible young woman who lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. Her business involves selling clothes and has been in existence for six years. Keydy operates her business from her home in the town where she lives, but she also sells in different places nearby.

She needs this loan so that she can buy blouses, trousers, dresses, skirts, shirts, shorts, and other items in order to have sufficient inventory to sell. Since the Christmas season is approaching, her customers are demanding more merchandise. With this loan Keydy expects to increase her sales. The loan will be of great help since she does not have the necessary products to fulfill the orders from her customers.

Keydy wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family a little bit with the increase in her household income. In the short-term, she hopes to grow her business, continue supporting her family, and provide her children the education they need to have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, dresses, skirts, shirts, shorts, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir lives in Yerevan with his parents, wife and two little children. He is a hairdresser with seven years of experience working in beauty salon. In a rented stall of the beauty salon, Vladimir provides different types of hairdressing services. Due to his professional work, Vladimir has a list of loyal customers who use only his services. Now, this talented hairdresser asks for a loan to purchase supplies that he needs for his work, like dyes and scissors.
 
Vladimir has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Vladimir to enlarge his business and to be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that he needs for his work, like dyes and scissors.

loans.name: Abuzar

texts.en:
Abuzar is 35 years of age, married, and is raising two children with his wife. Two years ago, he decided to open a business so that he could support his family, which is comprised of his wife and two children. He works together with his two assistants in a small cafeteria, which he built through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well-known due to its strategic location and good service.

Abuzar's biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can service more customers. Therefore, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to remodel and buy inventory. He hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: to remodel and buy inventory.
